Subsubsection Title: Sources and Uses for the Endemol Shine Acquisition
Subsubsection Text: The expected estimated sources and uses of the funds necessary to consummate the Endemol Shine Acquisition and repay certain existing debt of Endemol Shine are shown in the table below, based on an assumed closing date of March 31, 2020. Actual amounts may differ from estimated amounts depending on several factors, including the issue price of the Dollar Senior Secured Notes and the Senior Notes, differences between our estimates of fees and expenses and the actual fees and expenses incurred, fluctuations in exchange rates, accrued interest on the debt being repaid, the actual date of repayment of such debt and the actual date of the consummation of the Endemol Shine Acquisition.

(1) Represents the estimated gross proceeds of the Euro Senior Secured Notes offered hereby, assuming an issuance at par. (2) Represents the principal amount outstanding under the Existing Senior Term Loan immediately prior to the Refinancing (€44.6 million), plus accrued but unpaid interest up to, but excluding, the Issue Date (€0.2 million). (3) Represents (i) the principal amount outstanding under the Existing Notes (€365.0 million), plus (ii) the redemption premium (€7.3 million) to be paid to the holders of the Existing Notes on the Issue Date in connection with the Refinancing, plus (iii) accrued and unpaid interest on the Existing Notes up to, but excluding, the Issue Date (€1.2 million). (4) Represents the refinancing of the consideration paid for the Bear Grylls Acquisition. We drew £20.0 million under our Existing Revolving Credit Facility in October 2019 to pay the consideration for the Bear Grylls Acquisition, and repaid such drawing with cash generated by our business prior to December 31, 2019. A portion of the proceeds from the offering of the Euro Senior Secured Notes will be used to replenish our cash on hand for the same amount. (5) Represents the portion of the proceeds from the issuance of the Euro Senior Secured Notes that will remain on the balance sheet of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer on the Issue Date and that we intend to use as part of the financing of the Endemol Shine Acquisition on the Acquisition Completion Date. The Euro Senior Secured Notes are not subject to a special mandatory redemption and, as a result, will remain outstanding even if the Endemol Shine Acquisition is not consummated and the Dollar Senior Secured Notes and the Senior Notes are redeemed pursuant to a special mandatory redemption applicable to those Notes. See “Risk Factors—Risks Related to the _Endemol Shine Acquisition—The Euro Senior Secured Notes are not subject to a special mandatory redemption and will remain outstanding even if the Endemol Shine Acquisition is not consummated, in which case the amount available under the Revolving Credit Facility would be limited and such facility will be automatically designated as a super senior liability in accordance with, and subject to, the terms of the Intercreditor Agreement.” If the Endemol Shine Acquisition is not consummated, the portion of the proceeds of the Euro_ Senior Secured Notes remaining on the balance sheet of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer will be used for the general corporate purposes of the Group, including the payment of certain fees and expenses in connection with the Endemol Shine Acquisition. (6) Represents the estimated fees and expenses associated with the Refinancing, including placement, financial advisory and other transaction costs and professional fees. 15 -----

(1) Represents the euro-equivalent of the estimated gross proceeds of the Dollar Senior Secured Notes offered hereby, assuming an issuance at par, which will be deposited into the Dollar Senior Secured Notes Escrow Account on the Issue Date. (2) Represents the estimated gross proceeds of the Senior Notes offered hereby, assuming an issuance at par, which will be deposited into the Senior Notes Escrow Account on the Issue Date. (3) Represents the euro-equivalent of amounts expected to be drawn under the EUR Term Loan B and the USD Term Loan B in connection with the Endemol Shine Acquisition on or about the Acquisition Completion Date, assuming borrowings at par. (4) Represents the combined shareholder funding to be provided by Financière LOV S.A.S. and Fimalac, together through LDH, and by Vivendi in connection with the Transactions. (5) Represents the purchase price for the entire share capital of the Target. (6) Represents the repayment of certain existing indebtedness of Endemol Shine, including indebtedness under its syndicated credit facilities (€1,553.0 million), indebtedness under a shareholder loan (€29.7 million), interest accrued on the foregoing (€39.3 million), the unwinding of certain hedging obligations in connection therewith (€6.0 million), the repayment of certain bilateral facilities (€5.8 million), as well as payment obligations under Endemol Shine’s long-term incentive plan (€15.4 million). We intend to roll over Endemol Shine’s Borrowing Base Facility (€44.6 million (equivalent)), its finance leases (€136.9 million) and a portion of its bilateral facilities (€27.2 million). See “Capitalization.” (7) Represents the estimated fees and expenses associated with the Transactions, including placement, financial advisory and other transaction costs and professional fees.

The Senior Notes Issuer was incorporated on September 4, 2007. It is a société par actions simplifiée, incorporated and established under the laws of France, registered with the registre du commerce et des sociétés _de Paris under registration number 499 797 041 and having its registered office at 5, rue Francois 1er, 75008_ Paris, France.

The Senior Secured Notes Issuer was incorporated on March 11, 2008. It is a société par actions simplifiée, incorporated and established under the laws of France, registered with the registre du commerce et des sociétés _de Paris under registration number 503 069 965 and having its registered office at 5, rue Francois 1er, 75008_ Paris, France.

Following the completion of the Transactions, LOV Banijay will directly own the majority of the share capital of LDH, which in turn will own 67.1% of the share capital of Banijay Group Holding, the parent company 16 ----- of the Senior Notes Issuer. LOV Group was created in 2007 by Stéphane Courbit with the ambition to position itself at the heart of growing markets such as audiovisual production, luxury hotels and online sports betting. LOV Group currently operates in over 25 countries and is the main shareholder in almost all of its subsidiaries, such as Betclic Everest Group, LOV Hotel Collection and the Senior Notes Issuer. LOV Group’s mission is to identify growing markets, develop new businesses as well as seek investments in innovative and high growth potential companies. LOV Group provides its subsidiaries with human, financial, legal and strategic support.

DeA, founded in 1901, is a family-owned group active worldwide through four business areas: publishing; content production and distribution; gaming services; and private equity investments. De Agostini S.p.A. is controlled by B&D Holding, a limited liability company owned by the Boroli and Drago families. De Agostini S.p.A. is the holding that coordinates the strategic operating companies (De Agostini Editore, De Agostini Communications, IGT and DeA Capital) and makes financial investments, among which the main investment is a minority stake in Assicurazioni Generali.

Fimalac, founded in 1991, is an investment company owned by Marc Ladreit de Lacharrière, which operates in five business areas: private equity, digital media, entertainment, leisure activities and hotels and real estate. In addition to a direct investment in LDH, Fimalac will reinforce its long-term partnership with Financière LOV S.A.S., the President of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer, by increasing its stake in Financière LOV S.A.S. from 5.8% to 8.4%.

Following the completion of the Transactions, Vivendi will own 32.9% of the share capital of Banijay Group Holding. Vivendi is an integrated media, content and communication group. Vivendi operates businesses throughout the media value chain, from talents discovery to the creation, production and distribution of content. The main subsidiaries of Vivendi comprise Universal Music Group, Canal Plus Group, Havas Group and Editis. Universal Music Group is engaged in recorded music, music publishing and merchandising. It owns more than 50 labels covering all genres. Canal Plus Group is engaged in pay-television in France, as well as in Africa, Poland, Benelux, central Europe and Vietnam. Havas Group is one of the world’s largest global communications groups with a presence in more than 100 countries around the world. Editis is the second-largest French-language publishing group, encompassing around 50 publishing houses and a large portfolio of internationally-acclaimed authors. If the Endemol Shine Acquisition is not consummated, following completion of the Refinancing, (i) Stéphane Courbit’s holding company LOV Banijay will directly own 50.1% of the issued share capital of LDH and DeA will own the remaining 49.9% of the issued share capital of LDH; (ii) LDH will own 68.6% of the issued share capital of Banijay Group Holding, and Vivendi will own the remaining 31.4%; (iii) Banijay Group Holding will own 89.4% of the issued share capital of the Senior Notes Issuer; (iv) the Senior Notes Issuer will own 100.0% of the issued share capital of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer; (v) the Senior Secured Notes Issuer will not own any of the issued share capital of the Target and (vi) Fimalac will not directly own any of the issued share capital of LDH, but will continue to hold a stake in Financière LOV S.A.S. The shareholding percentages in this section are indicative and may be subject to variations in connection with the Transactions.

Prior to the date of this offering memorandum, and in connection with an internal reorganization to simplify our corporate structure, we transferred ownership of the shares held by the Senior Notes Issuer in each of its material subsidiaries (other than the Senior Secured Notes Issuer) to the Senior Secured Notes Issuer (the “Reorganization”). As a result of the Reorganization, the only direct material subsidiary of the Senior Notes Issuer is the Senior Secured Notes Issuer, in which the Senior Notes Issuer holds 100.0% ownership. 17 -----

_Funwood Media_ On October 1, 2019, Banijay acquired 51% of the issued and outstanding share capital of Funwood Media Italia S.r.l and Funwood Media Iberica S.r.l (together, “Funwood Media”), with an option to acquire the remaining shares in the future. Funwood Media focuses on the distribution of scripted and non-scripted programs in Italy and Spain. Funwood Media also produces content in Spain, mainly of kids’ programs. In addition, Funwood Media operates a dubbing business in Italy. Banijay financed the acquisition of Funwood Media with cash from operating activities. _The Bear Grylls Acquisition_ On October 7, 2019, Banijay acquired 51% of the issued and outstanding share capital of The Natural Studios, which was incorporated in November 2018 and which holds 100% of the issued share capital of BGV Media Limited, the content production company of Bear Grylls (the “Bear Grylls Acquisition”). The agreement pursuant to which Banijay acquired The Natural Studios provides for put and call options over the remaining 49% outstanding shares in The Natural Studios. In connection with the Bear Grylls Acquisition, Banijay entered into a shareholders’ agreement setting forth the terms of the partnership between the Senior Notes Issuer and Bear Grylls through The Natural Studios, including the terms and conditions for the development, production and distribution of new shows featuring Bear Grylls and other talents. Banijay financed the Bear Grylls Acquisition with cash from operating activities. Bear Grylls hosts shows such as Man vs. Wild and The Island with Bear Grylls, which are highly popular adventure television programs with international audiences. Bear Grylls is an adventure and nature specialist and appears in shows that are aired in the United States, the United Kingdom, India and China. He successfully developed and hosted an interactive adventure show for Netflix called You vs. Wild and has sold programs to Facebook Watch and Amazon Prime Video. The Bear Grylls Acquisition enables us to reinforce our existing catalogue of adventure formats and programs such as Survivor, Fort Boyard, The Crystal Maze, The Bridge, The _Island and 71 Degrees North with a strong brand and to add future formats to be developed by Bear Grylls and_ his team, with the aim of becoming a leader in the adventure shows genre. The Bear Grylls Acquisition also allows us to partner with Bear Grylls, a unique and renowned talent, and try to attract other adventure talents. We benefit from Bear Grylls’ exclusivity and will produce all future Bear Grylls’ non-scripted shows, and potential future scripted shows, to be aired in the markets in which we currently operate or on a global platform. Our internal distribution unit will distribute these shows when the distribution has not been granted to the broadcaster or platform. _Lucky Pics_ On November 7, 2019, Banijay acquired control over Lucky Pics, a joint venture in Germany, of which Brainpool indirectly owns 50%, following a change in the governance of the company. _W&B TV_ On November 13, 2019, Endemol Shine Germany, Max Wiedemann and Quirin Berg entered into an agreement to sell joint venture W&B Television GmbH & Co. KG (“W&B TV”) to German media company Leonine. Endemol Shine Germany also agreed to acquire 100% of the assets of W&B TV’s Berlin-based business to create a new scripted content production company in Germany. W&B TV produces and develops several fictional television movies, television series and sketch comedies. The sale of W&B TV closed on January 7, 2020 and the acquisition of W&B TV’s Berlin-based business closed on January 9, 2020.

Based on the preliminary draft of our internal management accounts, Banijay currently expects its revenues for the year ended December 31, 2019, to amount to approximately €1,004 million. Banijay also currently expects its Adjusted EBITDA (including the impact of the application of IFRS 16) for the year ended December 31, 2019, to amount to approximately €154 million, and Pro Forma Run-Rate Adjusted EBITDA for the Combined Group for the year ended December 31, 2019, after giving effect to the Transactions and related cost savings and synergies, to amount to approximately €479 million. 18 ----- Based on the preliminary draft of Endemol Shine’s internal management accounts, Endemol Shine currently expects its revenues for the year ended December 31, 2019, to amount to approximately €1,688 million. Endemol Shine also currently expects its Adjusted EBITDA (including the impact of the application of IFRS 16) for the year ended December 31, 2019, to amount to approximately €252 million. _The preliminary results and estimates presented above have not been audited, are derived from internal management accounts, are the responsibility of management of Banijay or Endemol Shine, as applicable, and are subject to our or Endemol Shine’s financial closing procedures. These procedures have not been completed. While we and Endemol Shine, as applicable, believe these preliminary results and estimates to be reasonable, our and Endemol Shine’s actual results could vary from these estimates and these differences could be material. As such, you should not place undue reliance on this information. This information is not indicative of the results for year ended December 31, 2019, the quarter ended December 31, 2019 or any future period. Neither Ernst & Young et Autres nor PricewaterhouseCoopers Accountants N.V. has audited, reviewed, compiled, or applied agreed-upon procedures with respect to the preliminary financial data. Accordingly, neither Ernst & Young et Autres nor PricewaterhouseCoopers Accountants N.V. expresses an opinion or any other form of assurance with respect thereto. See “Disclosure Regarding Forward-Looking Statements,” “Risk Factors” “Banijay’s Management’s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations,” “Endemol Shine’s Management’s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations,” and “Unaudited Pro Forma Consolidated Financial Information” in this offering memorandum for a more complete discussion of certain of the factors that could affect our and Endemol Shine’s future performance._ 19 -----

See “Certain _Relationships and Related Party Transactions—Earn-outs.”_ (3) The Senior Secured Notes Issuer is offering €525.0 million in aggregate principal amount of the Euro Senior Secured Notes. The Euro Senior Secured Notes will be general senior secured obligations of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer and will (i) rank pari passu in right of payment with all existing and future senior indebtedness of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer, including indebtedness outstanding under the Senior Facilities, (ii) rank senior in right of payment to all of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer’s existing and future indebtedness that is expressly subordinated in right of payment to the Euro Senior Secured Notes, (iii) be effectively subordinated to all of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer’s existing and future indebtedness that is secured by property or assets that do not secure the Euro Senior Secured Notes to the extent of the value of the property or assets securing such indebtedness and (iv) be structurally subordinated to any existing and future debt of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer’s existing and future subsidiaries that do not guarantee the Euro Senior Secured Notes, including their obligations to trade creditors. (4) The Euro Senior Secured Notes will be guaranteed on a senior secured basis on the Issue Date, by the Issue Date Guarantors, subject to the Agreed Security Principles and to the limitations described in “Certain Insolvency Law Considerations and Limitations on the _Validity and Enforceability of the Guarantees and the Security Interests.” Each of the Guarantees of the Euro Senior Secured Notes will_ (i) be general senior secured obligations of the Guarantors, (ii) rank pari passu in right of payment with all such Guarantors’ existing and future senior indebtedness that is not expressly subordinated in right of payment to the Euro Senior Secured Notes and any guarantees thereof, including indebtedness outstanding under the Senior Facilities and any guarantees thereof, (iii) rank senior in right of payment to all of such Guarantor’s existing and future indebtedness that is expressly subordinated in right of payment to the Euro Senior Secured Notes and any guarantees thereof and (iv) be effectively subordinated to all of such Guarantor’s existing and future indebtedness that is secured by property or assets that do not secure the Euro Senior Secured Notes to the extent of the value of the property or assets securing such indebtedness. The laws of certain jurisdictions in which the Guarantors are organized limit the amount of obligations that may be guaranteed, or in respect of which security interests may be provided as well as the enforceability of the Guarantees and the rights to the security securing the Euro Senior Secured Notes and the guarantees thereof. For more information on limitations to the validity and enforceability of the Guarantees and the security interests in the Collateral and the liability of the Guarantors and the security providers, see “Certain _Insolvency Law Considerations and Limitations on the Validity and Enforceability of the Guarantees and the Security Interests.”_ As of and for the year ended December 31, 2018, the Issue Date Guarantors accounted for 83.8% of Banijay’s total assets, 38.4% of Banijay’s consolidated revenues and 67.6% of Banijay’s EBITDA. (5) Subject to the Agreed Security Principles, on the Issue Date, the Euro Senior Secured Notes will be secured by the Issue Date Senior Secured Notes Collateral. The Senior Secured Notes Collateral will also secure the Senior Facilities, ranking pari passu with the security granted for the benefit of the Senior Facilities. The laws of certain jurisdictions in which our subsidiaries are organized limit the amount of obligations in respect of which security interests may be provided as well as the enforceability of the rights to the security securing the Euro Senior Secured Notes and the guarantees thereof. For more information on limitations to the validity and enforceability of the Guarantees and the security interests in the Collateral and the liability of the Guarantors and the security providers, see “Certain Insolvency Law Considerations and Limitations _on the Validity and Enforceability of the Guarantees and the Security Interests.”_ (6) In connection with the Transactions, the Senior Secured Notes Issuer will enter into the Senior Secured Credit Facilities Agreement to provide for a Revolving Credit Facility in the amount of €170.0 million to finance the general corporate and ongoing working capital needs of the Group, of which €75.0 million (equivalent) will be available prior to the Acquisition Completion Date. We currently expect the Revolving Credit Facility to remain undrawn on the Issue Date. See “Description of Other Indebtedness and Financing _Arrangements—Senior Secured Credit Facilities Agreement.” Prior to the completion of the Endemol Shine Acquisition and if the_ Endemol Shine Acquisition is not consummated, drawings up to €75.0 million (equivalent) will be available under the Revolving Credit Facility to fund the ongoing operations of Banijay. If the Endemol Shine Acquisition is not consummated, the Revolving Credit Facility will be automatically designated as a super senior liability in accordance with the terms of the Intercreditor Agreement. See “The _Transactions.”_ (7) In order to complete the Refinancing, the Senior Secured Notes Issuer will on-lend on or around the Issue Date a portion of the proceeds of the Euro Senior Secured Notes by way of the Senior Secured Notes Proceeds Loans in an aggregate principal amount of €233.0 million to its subsidiaries that entered into intercompany loans with the Senior Notes Issuer in 2017 to receive a portion of the proceeds of the issuance of the Existing Notes and borrowings under the Existing Senior Credit Facilities. The Senior Secured Notes Issuer and these subsidiaries will use the proceeds of the Senior Secured Notes Proceeds Loans to repay these intercompany loans to the Senior Notes Issuer, which will use the proceeds to repay the Existing Notes and the Existing Senior Credit Facilities. See “Use of Proceeds.” 21 -----

See “Shareholders,” “Use of Proceeds” and “The Transactions.” (2) Following the completion of the Transactions, certain key managers of the Combined Group will indirectly own 7.8% of the issued share capital of the Senior Notes Issuer through wholly-owned or majority-owned intermediate holding companies. See “Certain Relationships _and Related Party Transactions—Earn-outs.”_ (3) The Senior Secured Notes Issuer is offering €525.0 million in aggregate principal amount of the Euro Senior Secured Notes and $363.0 million in aggregate principal amount of the Dollar Senior Secured Notes. The Senior Secured Notes will be general senior secured obligations of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer and will (i) rank pari passu in right of payment with all existing and future senior indebtedness of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer, including indebtedness outstanding under the Senior Facilities, (ii) rank senior in right |Non-Guarantor Subsidiaries(5)|AP NMT JV Newco B.V. (the “Target”)(1)|Col3| |---|---|---| |||| 22 ----- of payment to all of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer’s existing and future indebtedness that is expressly subordinated in right of payment to the Senior Secured Notes, (iii) be effectively subordinated to all of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer’s existing and future indebtedness that is secured by property or assets that do not secure the Senior Secured Notes to the extent of the value of the property or assets securing such indebtedness and (iv) be structurally subordinated to any existing and future debt of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer’s existing and future subsidiaries that do not guarantee the Senior Secured Notes, including their obligations to trade creditors. (4) The Senior Notes Issuer is offering €400.0 million in aggregate principal amount of the Senior Notes. The Senior Notes will be general senior obligations of the Senior Notes Issuer and will (i) rank pari passu in right of payment with all existing and future senior indebtedness of the Senior Notes Issuer, (ii) rank senior in right of payment to all of the Senior Notes Issuer’s existing and future indebtedness that is expressly subordinated in right of payment to the Senior Notes, (iii) be effectively subordinated to all of the Senior Notes Issuer’s existing and future indebtedness that is secured by property or assets that do not secure the Senior Notes, or that is secured on a first-ranking basis by property or assets that secure the Senior Notes on a second-ranking basis, to the extent of the value of the property or assets securing such indebtedness and (iv) be structurally subordinated to any existing and future debt of the Senior Notes Issuer’s existing and future subsidiaries that do not guarantee the Senior Notes, including their obligations to trade creditors. (5) The Senior Secured Notes will be guaranteed on a senior secured basis (i) on the Issue Date, by the Issue Date Guarantors and (ii) within 60 days from the Acquisition Completion Date, by the Post-Completion Date Guarantors, provided that (x) such guarantees shall in each case be granted substantially simultaneously with the guarantees granted in favor of obligations under the Senior Secured Credit Facilities Agreement and subject to any requirements therein (and for the avoidance of doubt, shall not be required to be granted any earlier than those obligations under the Senior Secured Credit Facilities Agreement) and (y) are in all cases subject to the Agreed Security Principles and to the limitations described in “Certain Insolvency Law Considerations and Limitations on the Validity and _Enforceability of the Guarantees and the Security Interests.” Each of the Guarantees of the Senior Secured Notes will (i) be general_ senior secured obligations of the Guarantors, (ii) rank pari passu in right of payment with all such Guarantors’ existing and future senior indebtedness that is not expressly subordinated in right of payment to the Senior Secured Notes and any guarantees thereof, including indebtedness outstanding under the Senior Facilities and any guarantees thereof, (iii) rank senior in right of payment to all of such Guarantor’s existing and future indebtedness that is expressly subordinated in right of payment to the Senior Secured Notes and any guarantees thereof and (iv) be effectively subordinated to all of such Guarantor’s existing and future indebtedness that is secured by property or assets that do not secure the Senior Secured Notes to the extent of the value of the property or assets securing such indebtedness. The Senior Notes will be guaranteed on a senior subordinated and unsecured basis (i) on the Issue Date, by the Issue Date Guarantors and (ii) within 60 days from the Acquisition Completion Date, by the Post-Completion Date Guarantors, provided that (x) such guarantees shall in each case be granted substantially simultaneously with the guarantees granted in favor of obligations under the Senior Secured Credit Facilities Agreement and the Senior Secured Notes and subject to any requirements in the Senior Secured Credit Facilities Agreement (and for the avoidance of doubt, shall not be required to be granted any earlier than those obligations under the Senior Secured Credit Facilities Agreement) and (y) are in all cases subject to the Agreed Security Principles and to the limitations described in “Certain Insolvency Law Considerations and Limitations on the Validity and Enforceability of the Guarantees and the _Security Interests.” Each of the Guarantees of the Senior Notes will (i) be subordinated in right of payment to all such Guarantors’_ existing and future senior indebtedness, including indebtedness outstanding under the Senior Facilities and the Senior Secured Notes and, in each case, any guarantees thereof, (ii) rank pari passu in right of payment with all such Guarantors’ existing and future other senior subordinated indebtedness, (iii) rank senior in right of payment to all of such Guarantor’s existing and future indebtedness that is expressly subordinated in right of payment to the Senior Notes and the guarantees thereof and (iv) be effectively subordinated to all of such Guarantor’s existing and future secured indebtedness, including the Senior Facilities, the Senior Secured Notes and any guarantees thereof, to the extent of the value of the property or assets securing such indebtedness. The laws of certain jurisdictions in which the Guarantors are organized limit the amount of obligations that may be guaranteed, or in respect of which security interests may be provided as well as the enforceability of the Guarantees and the rights to the security securing the Notes and the Guarantees. For more information on limitations to the validity and enforceability of the Guarantees and the security interests in the Collateral and the liability of the Guarantors and the security providers, see “Certain Insolvency Law Considerations and _Limitations on the Validity and Enforceability of the Guarantees and the Security Interests.”_ Giving effect to the Endemol Shine Acquisition, as of and for the year ended December 31, 2018, the Guarantors would have accounted for 82.9% of the consolidated pro forma total assets, 52.6% of the consolidated pro forma revenues and 80.5% of the consolidated pro _forma EBITDA of the Combined Group. As of September 30, 2019, after giving effect to the Transactions, subsidiaries of the Senior_ Notes Issuer (excluding Endemol Shine) not guaranteeing the Notes had total debt of €17.8 million (excluding debt incurred under the Existing Senior Credit Facilities Agreement (which will be repaid as part of the Refinancing) and intercompany loans) and subsidiaries of the Target not guaranteeing the Notes had total debt of €77.7 million (excluding intercompany loans). (6) Subject to the Agreed Security Principles, on the Issue Date, the Senior Secured Notes will be secured by the Issue Date Senior Secured Notes Collateral and the Dollar Senior Secured Notes will be additionally secured by the Escrow Charge on the Dollar Senior Secured Notes Escrow Account. Upon the release of the Escrowed Property on the Escrow Release Date, this Escrow Charge will be released. See “—The Transactions—Escrow Accounts.” In addition, the Senior Secured Notes will be secured (i) on or prior to the date falling ten business days after the Acquisition Completion Date, by the Completion Date Senior Secured Notes Collateral and (ii) on or prior to the date falling 60 days after the Acquisition Completion Date, by the Post-Completion Date Senior Secured Notes Collateral, in each case substantially simultaneously with the collateral granted to secure the obligations under the Senior Secured Credit Facilities Agreement and subject to the Agreed Security Principles. The Senior Secured Notes Collateral will also secure the Senior Facilities, ranking pari _passu with the security granted for the benefit of the Senior Facilities._ On the Issue Date, the Senior Notes will be secured by the Escrow Charge on the Senior Notes Escrow Account. In addition, on or around the Acquisition Completion Date, and subject to the Agreed Security Principles, the Senior Notes will be secured by the Senior Notes Collateral. The laws of certain jurisdictions in which our subsidiaries are organized limit the amount of obligations in respect of which security interests may be provided as well as the enforceability of the rights to the security securing the Notes and the Guarantees. For more 23 ----- information on limitations to the validity and enforceability of the Guarantees and the security interests in the Collateral and the liability of the Guarantors and the security providers, see “Certain Insolvency Law Considerations and Limitations on the Validity and _Enforceability of the Guarantees and the Security Interests.”_ (7) In connection with the Transactions, the Senior Secured Notes Issuer will enter into the Senior Secured Credit Facilities Agreement to provide for a EUR Term Loan B and a USD Term Loan B in an aggregate principal amount of €953.0 million (equivalent) and a Revolving Credit Facility in the amount of €170.0 million to finance the general corporate and ongoing working capital needs of the Group, of which €75.0 million (equivalent) will be available prior to the Acquisition Completion Date. The Guarantors will guarantee the obligations under the Senior Facilities on a senior secured basis. It is intended that the full principal amount of €503.0 million under the EUR Term Loan B will be drawn by the Senior Secured Notes Issuer and that the full principal amount of €450.0 million (equivalent) under the USD Term Loan B will be drawn by the U.S. Borrower. The amount drawn under the USD Term Loan B by the U.S. Borrower will subsequently be on-lent by the U.S. Borrower to the Senior Secured Notes Issuer. We currently expect the Revolving Credit Facility to remain undrawn on the Issue Date. See “Description of Other Indebtedness and Financing Arrangements—Senior Secured Credit _Facilities Agreement.”_ (8) The cash consideration payable under the terms of the Endemol Shine Acquisition will be financed in part by a combination of shareholder funding in the amount of €275.0 million (the “Equity Contribution”) to be provided by Financière LOV S.A.S. and Fimalac, together through LDH, and by Vivendi to Banijay Group Holding. Banijay Group Holding will contribute such funds to the Senior Notes Issuer, which will in turn contribute such funds to the Senior Secured Notes Issuer. In addition, on or around the Acquisition Completion Date, the Senior Notes Issuer will advance the proceeds of the Senior Notes Offering to the Senior Secured Notes Issuer by way of the Senior Notes Proceeds Loan. It is intended that the Senior Secured Notes Issuer will use the proceeds of the Equity Contribution and Senior Notes Proceeds Loan, together with the proceeds of the offering of the Dollar Senior Secured Notes, amounts drawn under the Senior Facilities and cash on balance sheet, to (i) acquire 100% of the share capital of the Target, (ii) refinance certain existing indebtedness of the Target and (iii) pay the fees and expenses incurred in connection with the Transactions. See “The Transactions,” “Use of Proceeds” and “Capitalization.” (9) In order to complete the Refinancing, the Senior Secured Notes Issuer will on-lend on or around the Issue Date a portion of the proceeds of the Euro Senior Secured Notes by way of the Senior Secured Notes Proceeds Loans in an aggregate principal amount of €233.0 million to its subsidiaries that entered into intercompany loans with the Senior Notes Issuer in 2017 to receive a portion of the proceeds of the issuance of the Existing Notes and borrowings under the Existing Senior Credit Facilities. The Senior Secured Notes Issuer and these subsidiaries will use the proceeds of the Senior Secured Notes Proceeds Loans to repay these intercompany loans to the Senior Notes Issuer, which will use the proceeds to repay the Existing Notes and the Existing Senior Credit Facilities. See “Use of _Proceeds.”_ 24 -----

Senior Secured Notes . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . The Senior Secured Notes will: - be general senior secured obligations of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer, secured as set forth under “Description of the Senior _Secured Notes—Security”;_ - rank pari passu in right of payment with all existing and future senior indebtedness of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer, including indebtedness outstanding under the Senior Facilities; - rank senior in right of payment to all of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer’s existing and future indebtedness that is expressly subordinated in right of payment to the Senior Secured Notes; - be effectively subordinated to all of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer’s existing and future indebtedness that is secured by property or assets that do not secure the Senior Secured Notes to the extent of the value of the property or assets securing such indebtedness; and - be structurally subordinated to any existing and future debt of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer’s existing and future subsidiaries that do not guarantee the Senior Secured Notes, including their obligations to trade creditors. The Senior Notes will: - be general senior obligations of the Senior Notes Issuer, secured as set forth under “Description of the Senior Notes—Security”; - rank pari passu in right of payment with all existing and future senior indebtedness of the Senior Notes Issuer; - rank senior in right of payment to all of the Senior Notes Issuer’s existing and future indebtedness that is expressly subordinated in right of payment to the Senior Notes; - be effectively subordinated to all of the Senior Notes Issuer’s existing and future indebtedness that is secured by property or assets that do not secure the Senior Notes, or that is secured on a first-ranking basis by property or assets that secure the Senior Notes on a second-ranking basis, to the extent of the value of the property or assets securing such indebtedness; and - be structurally subordinated to any existing and future debt of the Senior Notes Issuer’s existing and future subsidiaries that do not guarantee the Senior Notes, including their obligations to trade creditors. Guarantors”) (the “Issue Date Guarantees”) and (ii) within 60 days from the Acquisition Completion Date by Endemol Shine IP B.V., MediArena Acquisition B.V., Endemol Shine Holding B.V., Endemol Shine Nederland Holding B.V., Endemol Shine Nederland B.V., Endemol Shine International Limited, Endemol UK Holding Limited, Shine TV Limited, Tiger Aspect Productions Limited, Kudos Film & Television Limited, Primetime Limited, Endemol USA Holdings Inc., Truly Original LLC and Endemol Shine France (the “Post-Completion Date Guarantors” and together with the Issue Date Guarantors, the “Guarantors”) (the “Post-Completion Date Guarantees” and together with the Issue Date Guarantees, the “Guarantees”), provided that (x) such guarantees shall in each case be granted substantially simultaneously with the guarantees granted in favor of obligations under the Senior Secured Credit Facilities Agreement and subject to any requirements therein (and for the avoidance of doubt, shall not be required to be granted any earlier than those obligations under the Senior Secured Credit Facilities Agreement) and (y) are in all cases subject to the Agreed Security Principles and to the limitations described in “Certain Insolvency Law _Considerations and Limitations on the Validity and Enforceability of the Guarantees and the Security Interests.”_ As of and for the year ended December 31, 2018, the Issue Date Guarantors accounted for 83.8% of Banijay’s total assets, 38.4% of Banijay’s consolidated revenues and 67.6% of Banijay’s EBITDA. Giving effect to the Endemol Shine Acquisition, as of and for the year ended December 31, 2018, the Guarantors would have accounted for 82.9% of the consolidated pro forma total assets, 52.6% of the consolidated pro forma revenues and 80.5% of the consolidated pro _forma EBITDA of the Combined Group. As of September 30, 2019,_ after giving effect to the Transactions, subsidiaries of the Senior Notes Issuer (excluding Endemol Shine) not guaranteeing the Notes had total debt of €17.8 million (excluding debt incurred under the Existing Senior Credit Facilities Agreement (which will be repaid as part of the Refinancing) and intercompany loans) and subsidiaries of the Target not guaranteeing the Notes had total debt of €77.7 million (excluding intercompany loans). Pursuant to the terms of the Senior Secured Credit Facilities Agreement and subject to the Agreed Security Principles, at certain testing dates, the Senior Secured Notes Issuer will be required to ensure that the guarantors of the Senior Facilities account for at least 75% of Banijay’s EBITDA. When becoming guarantors of the Senior Secured Facilities, such guarantors will also be required to guarantee the Notes, subject to the exceptions included in the Indentures. Each Guarantee will be subject to the terms of the Intercreditor Agreement and certain contractual and legal limitations. See “Description of Other Indebtedness and Financing Arrangements— _Intercreditor Agreement,” “Certain Insolvency Law Considerations and Limitations on the Validity and Enforceability of the Guarantees and the Security Interests.” By virtue of these limitations, a_ Guarantor’s obligation under its Guarantee could be significantly less than amounts payable with respect to the Notes, or a Guarantor may 27 ----- have effectively no obligation under its Guarantee. See “Risk _Factors—Risks Related to the Notes, the Guarantees and the Collateral—Corporate benefit, financial assistance laws and other limitations on the Guarantees may adversely affect the validity and enforceability of the Guarantees of the Notes and of the Collateral.”_ In addition, the Guarantees may be released under certain circumstances. See “Description of the Senior Secured Notes—Brief _Description of the Notes—Guarantees Release,” “Description of the Senior Notes—Brief Description of the Notes—Guarantees Release” and “Certain Insolvency Law Considerations and Limitations on the Validity and Enforceability of the Guarantees and the Security Interests.”_

Senior Secured Notes . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . Each of the Guarantees of the Senior Secured Notes will: - be general senior secured obligations of the Guarantors; - rank pari passu in right of payment with all such Guarantors’ existing and future senior indebtedness that is not expressly subordinated in right of payment to the Senior Secured Notes and any guarantees thereof, including indebtedness outstanding under the Senior Facilities and any guarantees thereof; - rank senior in right of payment to all of such Guarantor’s existing and future indebtedness that is expressly subordinated in right of payment to the Senior Secured Notes and any guarantees thereof; and - be effectively subordinated to all of such Guarantor’s existing and future indebtedness that is secured by property or assets that do not secure the Senior Secured Notes to the extent of the value of the property or assets securing such indebtedness. Senior Notes . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . Each of the Guarantees of the Senior Notes will: - be subordinated in right of payment to all such Guarantors’ existing and future senior indebtedness, including indebtedness outstanding under the Senior Facilities and the Senior Secured Notes and, in each case, any guarantees thereof; - rank pari passu in right of payment with all such Guarantors’ existing and future other senior subordinated indebtedness; - rank senior in right of payment to all of such Guarantor’s existing and future indebtedness that is expressly subordinated in right of payment to the Senior Notes and the guarantees thereof; and - be effectively subordinated to all of such Guarantor’s existing and future secured indebtedness, including the Senior Facilities, the Senior Secured Notes and any guarantees thereof, to the extent of the value of the property or assets securing such indebtedness.

Senior Secured Notes . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . Subject to the Agreed Security Principles, on the Issue Date, the Senior Secured Notes and the Guarantees thereof will be secured on a senior basis by: - a pledge over the share capital of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer held by the Senior Notes Issuer; 28 ----- - a pledge over any structural intercompany receivables owed to the Senior Notes Issuer by the Senior Secured Notes Issuer; - a pledge over any structural intercompany receivables owed to the Senior Secured Notes Issuer by any other Guarantor; - a pledge over the material bank accounts of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer; - a security interest over the assets of Banijay Entertainment Holdings US, Inc.; - a pledge over the share capital of Adventure Line Production S.A.S. held by Banijay France S.A.S.; - a floating charge over the assets of Zodiak Media Limited, Banijay Rights Limited, Bwark Productions Limited, RDF Television Limited and Castaway Television Productions Limited; - pledges over the share capital of Banijay Entertainment Holdings US, Inc., the U.S. Borrower, H2O Productions, Banijay France S.A.S., Zodiak Media Limited and Banijay Rights Limited held by the Senior Secured Notes Issuer; and - a security interest over the assets of Bunim-Murray Productions Inc., Bunim-Murray Productions LLC and the U.S. Borrower (the “Issue Date Senior Secured Notes Collateral”). On the Issue Date, the Dollar Senior Secured Notes will additionally be secured by a first-priority security interest over the Escrowed Property deposited into the Dollar Senior Secured Notes Escrow Account. Upon the release of the Escrowed Property on the Escrow Release Date, the Escrow Charges will be released. Subject to the Agreed Security Principles, on or prior to the date falling ten business days after the Acquisition Completion Date, the Senior Secured Notes will be secured by a first-ranking pledge over the share capital of the Target held by the Senior Secured Notes Issuer (the “Completion Date Senior Secured Notes Collateral”). Subject to the Agreed Security Principles, within 60 days from the Acquisition Completion Date, and substantially simultaneously with the collateral granted to secure the obligations under the Senior Secured Credit Facilities Agreement, the Senior Secured Notes and the Guarantees thereof will be secured on a senior basis by: - a pledge over the issued voting share capital of Endemol Shine IP B.V. and Endemol Shine Nederland Holding B.V. held by Endemol Shine Holding B.V.; - a pledge over the issued voting share capital of Endemol Shine Nederland B.V. held by Endemol Shine Nederland Holding B.V.; - a floating charge over the assets of Endemol Shine International Limited, Endemol UK Holding Limited, Shine TV Limited, Tiger Aspect Productions Limited, Kudos Film & Television Limited and Primetime Limited; and - a security interest over the assets of Endemol USA Holdings Inc. and Truly Original LLC (collectively, the “Post-Completion Date Senior Secured Notes Collateral” and together with the Issue Date Senior Secured Notes Collateral and the Completion Date Senior Secured Notes Collateral, the “Senior Secured Notes Collateral”). 29 ----- The Senior Secured Notes Collateral will also secure, on an equal and ratable basis, but subject to the terms of the Intercreditor Agreement, the liabilities under the Senior Facilities. Senior Notes . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . On the Issue Date, the Senior Notes will be secured by a charge over the Escrowed Property deposited into the Senior Notes Escrow Account on a first-priority basis. Upon the release of the Escrowed Property on the Escrow Release Date, the Escrow Charges will be released. Subject to the Agreed Security Principles, on or around the Acquisition Completion Date, the Senior Notes will be secured by (i) a pledge of the material bank accounts of the Senior Notes Issuer on a first-priority basis, (ii) a pledge over the shares of Senior Secured Notes Issuer on a second-priority basis and (iii) a pledge over the receivables owed to the Senior Notes Issuer by the Senior Secured Notes Issuer in respect of any proceeds loan pursuant to which the proceeds from the Senior Notes Offering are provided by the Senior Notes Issuer to the Senior Secured Notes Issuer on a second-priority basis (the “Senior Notes Collateral” and together with the Senior Secured Notes Collateral, the “Collateral”). The security interests may be limited by applicable law or subject to certain defenses that may limit their validity and enforceability and is in all cases subject to the Agreed Security Principles. For more information on the security interests granted, see “Description of the _Senior Secured Notes—Security” and “Description of the Senior Notes—Security” and for more information on potential limitations to_ the security interests, see “Certain Insolvency Law Considerations _and Limitations on the Validity and Enforceability of the Guarantees and the Security Interests” and “Risk Factors.” In addition, the_ security interests in the Collateral may be released under certain circumstances. Subject to the Indentures and the Intercreditor Agreement, the Collateral may be pledged to secure future indebtedness. For more information on the security interests granted, see “Description of the Senior Secured Notes—Security” and for more information on potential limitations to the security interests, see “Certain Insolvency Law Considerations and Limitations on the _Validity and Enforceability of the Guarantees and the Security Interests” and “Risk Factors.”_ Use of Proceeds . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .** The gross proceeds from the sale of the Notes will be approximately €1,250.0 million (equivalent). On the Issue Date, we intend to use the proceeds of the offering of the Euro Senior Secured Notes to (i) redeem all of Banijay’s outstanding Existing Notes, (ii) repay all amounts outstanding under Banijay’s Existing Senior Credit Facilities, (iii) refinance the consideration paid for the Bear Grylls Acquisition, (iv) fund cash to the balance sheet of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer, which we intend to use as part of the financing of the Endemol Shine Acquisition and (v) pay the fees and expenses incurred in connection with the Refinancing. On the Acquisition Completion Date, we intend to use the proceeds of the offering of the Dollar Senior Secured Notes and the Senior Notes, together with the Equity Contribution, and amounts drawn under the Senior Facilities and the portion of the cash proceeds of the offering of the Euro Senior Secured Notes remaining on our balance sheet, to (i) acquire 100% of 30 ----- the share capital of the Target, (ii) refinance certain existing indebtedness of the Target and (iii) pay the fees and expenses incurred in connection with the Transactions. See “Use of Proceeds.”

Senior Secured Notes . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . Prior to, 2022, the Senior Secured Notes Issuer may redeem all or part of the Senior Secured Notes at a redemption price equal to 100% of the principal amount thereof, plus accrued and unpaid interest, if any, plus a “make-whole” premium as described under “Description _of_ _the_ _Senior_ _Secured_ _Notes—Optional _Redemption.”_ Prior to, 2022, the Senior Secured Notes Issuer may, on one or more occasions, redeem up to 40% of the aggregate principal amount of each of the Dollar Senior Secured Notes and the Euro Senior Secured Notes with the proceeds from specified equity offerings at the redemption prices as described under “Description of _the Senior Secured Notes—Optional Redemption,” in each case plus_ accrued and unpaid interest and additional amounts, if any, to the date of redemption, provided that at least 50% of the original principal amount of the Dollar Senior Secured Notes or the Euro Senior Secured Notes, as applicable (including any additional Dollar Senior Secured Notes or Euro Senior Secured Notes, as the case may be) issued under the Senior Secured Notes Indenture remain outstanding. Prior to, 2022, the Senior Secured Notes Issuer may redeem up to 10% of the aggregate principal amount of each series of the Senior Secured Notes originally issued (including the aggregate principal amount of any additional Dollar Senior Secured Notes or Euro Senior Secured Notes, as the case may be, issued) in each calendar year at a redemption price equal to 103% of the principal amount thereof. At any time on or after, 2022, the Senior Secured Notes Issuer may redeem all or part of the Senior Secured Notes at the redemption prices described under “Description of the Senior Secured _Notes—Optional Redemption.”_ Senior Notes . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . Prior to, 2022, the Senior Notes Issuer may redeem all or part of the Senior Notes at a redemption price equal to 100% of the principal amount thereof, plus accrued and unpaid interest, if any, plus a “make-whole” premium as described under “Description of the _Senior Notes—Optional Redemption.”_ Prior to, 2022, the Senior Notes Issuer may, on one or more occasions, redeem up to 40% of the aggregate principal amount of the Senior Notes with the proceeds from specified equity offerings at the redemption price as described under “Description of the Senior _Notes—Optional Redemption,” plus accrued and unpaid interest and_ additional amounts, if any, to the date of redemption, provided that at least 60% of the original principal amount of the Senior Notes (including any additional Senior Notes) issued under the Senior Notes Indenture remain outstanding. At any time on or after, 2022, the Senior Notes Issuer may redeem all or part of the Senior Notes at the redemption prices as described under “Description _of_ _the_ _Senior_ _Notes—Optional _Redemption.”_ 31 -----

Redemption . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .** Any payments made by or on behalf of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer, the Senior Notes Issuer, any future guarantor or applicable paying agents with respect to the Senior Secured Notes or the Senior Notes, as applicable, will be made without withholding or deduction for taxes in any relevant taxing jurisdiction unless required by law. Subject to certain exceptions and limitations, if the Senior Secured Notes Issuer, the Senior Notes Issuer or applicable future guarantor or relevant Paying Agent is required by law to withhold or deduct such taxes with respect to a payment on any Note, the Senior Secured Notes Issuer, the Senior Notes Issuer or such future guarantor, as applicable, will pay the additional amounts necessary so that the net amount received after such withholding is not less than the amount that would have been received in the absence of the withholding. See “Description of the Senior Secured Notes—Withholding Taxes” and “Description of the Senior Notes—Withholding Taxes.” Subject to and as set forth in “Description of the Senior Secured _Notes—Withholding Taxes” and “Description of the Senior Notes— Withholding Taxes,” the Senior Secured Notes Issuer, the Senior_ Notes Issuer and any future guarantor will not be liable to pay any additional amounts to holders of the Senior Secured Notes and Senior Notes, as applicable, in certain circumstances. If certain changes in the law of any relevant taxing jurisdiction become effective after the issuance of such Notes which would impose withholding taxes or other deductions on the payments on the Notes, and would require the Issuers to pay additional amounts (as defined in “Description of the Senior Secured Notes—Withholding _Taxes” and “Description of the Senior Notes—Withholding Taxes”),_ the Issuers may redeem such Notes in whole, but not in part, at any time, at a redemption price of 100% of the principal amount, plus accrued and unpaid interest, if any, and additional amounts, if any, to, but excluding, the date of redemption. See “Description of the Senior _Secured Notes—Redemption for Taxation Reasons” and “Description of the Senior Notes—Redemption for Taxation Reasons.”_ Change of Control . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .** Upon the occurrence of certain change of control events, the Senior Secured Notes Issuer or Senior Notes Issuer, as applicable, will be required to offer to repurchase all outstanding Notes at a purchase price equal to 101% of the principal amount thereof, plus accrued and unpaid interest and additional amounts to, but excluding, the date of the purchase. See “Description of the Senior Secured Notes—Change _of Control” and “Description of the Senior Notes—Change of Control.”_ Tender Offers . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .** In connection with certain tender offers for either the Senior Secured Notes or Senior Notes, if holders of not less than 90% in aggregate principal amount of the applicable outstanding Notes validly tender and do not validly withdraw such Notes in such tender offer and the Senior Secured Notes Issuer, or Senior Notes Issuer, as applicable, or any third party making such a tender offer in lieu of the Issuers, purchases all of the Notes of such series validly tendered and not validly withdrawn by such holders, the Issuers or such third party will have the right to redeem the Senior Secured Notes or Senior Notes, as applicable, that remain outstanding in whole, but not in part, following such purchase at a price equal to the price offered to each other holder of such series of Notes. See “Description of the Senior 32 ----- _Secured Notes—Optional Redemption—General” and “Description of the Senior Notes—Optional Redemption—General.”_

Redemption . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .** Pending the consummation of the Endemol Shine Acquisition, the Initial Purchasers will deposit the gross proceeds from the offering of the Dollar Senior Secured Notes and the Senior Notes into the Escrow Accounts in the name of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer in respect of the Dollar Senior Secured Notes Escrow Account and in the name of the Senior Notes Issuer in respect of the Senior Notes Escrow Account, in each case, on the Issue Date. The release of the Escrowed Property is subject to the satisfaction of certain conditions. If such conditions are not satisfied by the Escrow Longstop Date, and the parties do not or cannot waive the relevant conditions pursuant to the Endemol Shine Acquisition Agreement, then the Endemol Shine Acquisition will not be consummated. If the conditions to the release of the Escrowed Property, as more fully described under “Description _of_ _the_ _Senior_ _Secured_ _Notes—Escrow_ _of_ _Proceeds;_ _Special Mandatory Redemption” and “Description of the Senior Notes— Escrow of Proceeds; Special Mandatory Redemption,” as applicable,_ have not been satisfied on or prior to the Escrow Longstop Date or upon the occurrence of certain other events, the Dollar Senior Secured Notes and the Senior Notes will be subject to a Special Mandatory Redemption as described in “Description of the Senior Secured _Notes—Escrow of Proceeds; Special Mandatory Redemption” and_ “Description of the Senior Notes—Escrow of Proceeds; Special _Mandatory Redemption,” as applicable, and you may not obtain the_ return you expect to receive on the Dollar Senior Secured Notes and the Senior Notes. On the Issue Date, the gross proceeds of the Euro Senior Secured Notes will not be placed into an escrow account and are intended to be used as set forth in “Use of Proceeds.” The Euro Senior Secured Notes are not subject to a special mandatory redemption and, as a result, will remain outstanding even if the Endemol Shine Acquisition is not consummated and the Dollar Senior Secured Notes and the Senior Notes are redeemed pursuant to a special mandatory redemption applicable to those Notes. See “Risk Factors—Risks _Related to the Endemol Shine Acquisition—The Euro Senior Secured Notes are not subject to a special mandatory redemption and will remain outstanding even if the Endemol Shine Acquisition is not consummated, in which case the amount available under the Revolving Credit Facility would be limited and such facility will be automatically designated as a super senior liability in accordance with, and subject to, the terms of the Intercreditor Agreement.”_ Certain Covenants . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .** The Indentures will limit, among other things, the ability of the Issuers and their restricted subsidiaries to: - incur or guarantee additional indebtedness and issue certain preference stock; - pay dividends, redeem share capital and make certain investments; - make certain other restricted payments; - create or permit to exist certain liens; - impose restrictions on the ability of the restricted subsidiaries to pay dividends; 33 ----- - transfer or sell certain assets; - merge or consolidate with other entities; - enter into certain transactions with affiliates; and - impair the security interests for the benefit of the holders of the Notes. Certain of the covenants will be suspended if and for as long as the Notes achieve investment-grade ratings. See “Description of the _Senior Secured Notes—Certain Covenants—Suspension of Covenants on Achievement of Investment Grade Status” and “Description of the Senior Notes—Certain Covenants—Suspension of Covenants on Achievement of Investment Grade Status.”_ Each of the covenants will be subject to significant exceptions and qualifications. See “Description of the Senior Secured Notes—Certain _Covenants”_ and “Description _of_ _the_ _Senior_ _Notes—Certain Covenants.”_ Transfer Restrictions . . . . . . . . . . . . . .** The Notes and the Guarantees have not been, and will not be, registered under U.S. federal or state or any foreign securities laws and are subject to restrictions on resale. See “Important Information _About This Offering Memorandum.” We are under no obligation, nor_ do we intend, to register the Notes or the Guarantees in the United States. Furthermore, the Notes will not have exchange or registration rights under the Securities Act.

Subsection Title: Absence of a Public Market for the
Subsubsection Text: Notes . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .** Although application will be made to the Authority for the listing of and permission to deal in the Notes on the Official List of the Exchange, no assurance can be given that the Notes will be listed on the Official List of the Exchange or that such listing will be maintained. The Notes will be new securities for which there is no market. Although the Initial Purchasers have informed us that they intend to make a market in the Notes, they are not obligated to do so and they may discontinue market-making at any time without notice. Accordingly, we cannot assure you that an active trading market for the Notes will develop or be maintained. Governing Law . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .** The Notes, the Guarantees and the Indentures will be governed by New York law. The Intercreditor Agreement and the Senior Secured Credit Facilities Agreement will be governed by English law; provided that certain information undertakings, restrictive covenants, events of default and related New York law definitions of the Senior Secured Credit Facilities Agreement and any non-contractual obligations arising out of or in connection with such information undertakings, restrictive covenants, events of default and related New York law definitions will be interpreted in accordance with New York law (without prejudice to the fact that the Senior Secured Credit Facilities Agreement is governed by English law). The Security Documents, subject to the Agreed Security Principles, will be governed by the laws of France, the Netherlands, England and Wales and the United States, as applicable. Risk Factors . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .** Investing in the Notes involves substantial risks. Please see the section of this offering memorandum captioned “Risk Factors” for a 34 ----- discussion of certain risks you should carefully consider before investing in the Notes. Senior Notes Trustee . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .** U.S. Bank Trustees Limited. Senior Secured Notes Trustee . . . . . . .** U.S. Bank Trustees Limited. Security Agent . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .** Elavon Financial Services DAC.
Transfer Agent . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .** U.S. Bank National Association.

Subsubsection Text: Agent . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .** Elavon Financial Services DAC. EBITDA, Adjusted EBITDA and Run-Rate Adjusted EBITDA as presented in this offering memorandum may differ from and may not be comparable to similarly titled measures used by other companies and differ from “Consolidated EBITDA” contained in “Description of the Senior Secured Notes” and “Description of the Senior Notes” and in the Indentures. We present EBITDA, Adjusted EBITDA and Run-Rate Adjusted EBITDA for informational purposes only. There can be no assurance that items we have identified for adjustment as non-recurring will not recur in the future or that similar items will not be incurred in the future. The calculations for Adjusted EBITDA and Run-Rate Adjusted EBITDA are based on various assumptions and management estimates. These amounts have not been, and, in certain cases, cannot be, audited, reviewed or verified by any independent accounting firm. This information is inherently subject to risks and uncertainties. It may not give an accurate or complete picture of the financial condition or results of operations of the acquired businesses or other transactions for the periods presented, may not be comparable to our consolidated financial statements or the other financial information included in this offering memorandum and should 38 ----- not be relied upon when making an investment decision. We present EBITDA, Adjusted EBITDA and Run-Rate Adjusted EBITDA because we believe they are helpful to investors as measures of our operating performance and ability to service our debt. EBITDA, Adjusted EBITDA and Run-Rate Adjusted EBITDA have limitations as analytical tools and should not be considered in isolation or as a substitute for analysis of our operating results as reported under IFRS. Subsubsection Text: (a) Unless otherwise indicated, and other than for percentages and ratios, the financial information of Banijay for the twelve months ended September 30, 2019 represents the mathematical calculation of subtracting the applicable financial information for the nine months ended September 30, 2018 from the applicable financial information for the year ended December 31, 2018 and adding the applicable financial information for the nine months ended September 30, 2019, without accounting for the difference regarding the first application of IFRS 16. (b) Our historical consolidated statements of profit or loss for the years ended December 31, 2016, 2017 and 2018 and the nine months ended September 30, 2018 were prepared under IAS 17, and our historical consolidated statement of profit or loss for the nine months ended September 30, 2019 was prepared under IFRS 16. Depreciation prepared on an IAS 17 basis represents depreciation, excluding depreciation of right-of-use assets that were accounted for as operating leases prior to the first application of IFRS 16. Amortization prepared on an IAS 17 basis represents amortization, excluding amortization of lease premiums which, following the first application of IFRS 16, are included within right-of-use assets on our balance sheet, with depreciation charged accordingly. (c) Represents the portion of EBITDA attributable to the first application of IFRS 16. (d) Represents current impairment losses and provisions, net of reversals, primarily incurred in connection with the depreciation of our intellectual property rights. (e) Represents operating expenses out of the ordinary course of business. For the nine months ended September 30, 2019, exceptional operating expenses primarily related to restructuring costs in Italy, where we provisioned a potential cash-out related to the requalification of employees with renewed temporary contracts, and in the United Kingdom, where we implemented plans to reduce staff costs. For the nine months ended September 30, 2018, and for the year ended December 31, 2018, exceptional operating expenses primarily related to the cancellation of Koh Lanta in France following an incident between two candidates as well as some restructuring and acquisition costs. For the year ended December 31, 2017, exceptional operating expenses primarily related to restructuring costs in France, Italy and the United States, as well as costs related to acquisitions. For the year ended December 31, 2016, exceptional operating expenses primarily related to the Banijay Zodiak Merger. See “Banijay’s Business—Employees.” 39 ----- (f) Represents share-based payment expenses in connection with long-term incentive plans entered into with certain key managers, which are multi-year schemes separate from remuneration contracts that are either cash-settled, with phantom shares exercisable after four to eight years, or equity-settled, with free shares granted over the years ended December 31, 2016 to 2025. These sharebased payment expenses are not cashed out in the year. (g) Represents the portion included in our Adjusted EBITDA of the depreciation and amortization of production costs in connection with the production of scripted content, including amortization of fiction productions, provisions for debt (excluding debt allocated to production) and provisions for other liabilities and charges. (h) Represents our estimate of the EBITDA contribution for the twelve months ended September 30, 2019, from the acquisition of The Natural Studios, as if the Bear Grylls Acquisition had been completed on October 1, 2018. We have derived this estimated EBITDA contribution in the amount of €10.6 million primarily from diligence reports prepared in connection with the Bear Grylls Acquisition prior to our signing of the Bear Grylls Acquisition Agreement, available management accounts and the budget of The Natural Studios for the year ended December 31, 2019. We incurred an additional €49.9 million of liabilities for earn-outs and put option liabilities in connection with the Bear Grylls Acquisition. (i) Represents our estimate of the EBITDA contribution for the twelve months ended September 30, 2019, from the consolidation of Brainpool in the amount of €5.3 million, based on the financial statements of Brainpool for the three months ended December 31, 2018, as Brainpool was fully consolidated with the Group on December 31, 2018, as if the consolidation had occurred on October 1, 2018. (j) Represents our estimate of the EBITDA contribution for the twelve months ended September 30, 2019, from the acquisitions of (i) Funwood Media in the amount of approximately €1.5 million, based on the audited financial statements of Funwood Media for the year ended December 31, 2018, (ii) Screen Media in Norway in the amount of €0.7 million, based on the audited financial statements of Screen Media for the year ended December 31, 2018, (iii) Good Times in the amount of €0.9 million, based on the audited financial statements of Good Times for the year ended December 31, 2018 and (iv) ITV Movie, an Italian independent producer of television programs, in the amount of €1.3 million, based on the audited financial statements of ITV Movie for the year ended December 31, 2018, as if each acquisition had occurred on October 1, 2018. (k) Represents our estimate of the EBITDA contribution for the twelve months ended September 30, 2019, from the consolidation of Lucky Pics in the amount of approximately €0.7 million based on the audited financial statements of Lucky Pics for the year ended December 31, 2018, and the management accounts of Lucky Pics for the nine months ended September 30, 2018 and 2019, as if the consolidation had occurred on October 1, 2018. (l) Represents our estimated annualized run-rate cost synergies in connection with (i) the acquisition of Screen Media in the amount of €1.2 million, which we expect to realize through operating cost savings and headcount reductions following the integration of corporate and management functions of Screen Media with our existing subsidiaries in Norway, and (ii) a restructuring plan in Italy following the merger of our subsidiaries Magnolia S.p.A. and Dry Media S.r.l., in the amount of €1.0 million that we expect to realize through headcount reductions following the integration of local management teams. These measures have already been implemented. (m) Represents (i) the estimated impact of the application of IFRS 16 on our results for the last quarter of the year ended December 31, 2018 (€3.7 million) and (ii) the impact of the acquisition of IFRS 16 lease liabilities (€0.4 million) in connection with the acquisitions of The Natural Studios, Funwood Media, Screen Media and Good Times and the consolidation of Lucky Pics and Brainpool. (5) Adjusted EBITDA margin is defined as Adjusted EBITDA as a percentage of revenues. (6) Adjusted Free Cash Flow is a performance measure we use and which we believe is used by investors. Adjusted Free Cash Flow is not a defined measure under IFRS. Therefore, Adjusted Free Cash Flow should be viewed as supplemental to, but not as a substitute for, measures presented in our consolidated statement of cash flows, which are determined in accordance with IFRS. As not all companies define Adjusted Free Cash Flow in the same way, Adjusted Free Cash Flow as shown in this offering memorandum may not be comparable to similarly titled measures used by other companies. See “Presentation of Financial and Other Information—Non IFRS _Financial Measures.”_ 40 ----- The following table shows a reconciliation of cash flow from operations before cost of net debt and tax to our Free Cash Flow and Adjusted Free Cash Flow for the periods indicated:
