Enforcement in France of such U.S. judgment could be obtained following proper (i.e., non ex parte) proceedings if such U.S. judgment is enforceable in the United States and if the French civil court is satisfied that certain conditions have been met. For further information, see “Service of Process and Enforcement of Civil Liabilities.”

Subsection Title: Risks Related to the Notes, the Guarantees and the Collateral
Subsubsection Title: The Issuers may not be able to raise the funds necessary to finance a change of control offer and, if this occurs, the Issuers would be in default under the Indentures.
Subsubsection Text: If a change of control (as defined in the respective Indenture) occurs, the Issuers will be required to make an offer to purchase all the outstanding Notes at a price equal to 101% of the principal amount thereof, plus any accrued and unpaid interest and additional amounts, if any, to, but excluding, the date of purchase. In such a situation, the Issuers may not have enough funds to pay for all of the Notes that are tendered under any such offer. If a significant principal amount of Notes is tendered, the Issuers will likely have to obtain financing to pay for the tendered Notes. However, the Issuers may not be able to obtain such financing on acceptable terms, if at all. A change of control may also result in a mandatory prepayment under the Senior Secured Credit Facilities Agreement and agreements governing any future indebtedness and may result in the acceleration of such indebtedness. Any failure by the Issuers to offer to purchase the Notes upon a change of control would constitute a default under the Indentures, which would, in turn, constitute a default under the Senior Secured Credit Facilities Agreement. The change of control provision contained in the Indentures may not necessarily afford you protection in the event of certain important corporate events, including reorganizations, restructurings, mergers, recapitalizations or other similar transactions involving us that may adversely affect you, because such corporate events may not involve a shift in voting power or beneficial ownership or, even if they do, may not constitute a change of control as defined in the Indentures. In addition, the occurrence of certain events that might otherwise constitute a change of control will be deemed not to be a change of control, provided that upon consummation thereof, a certain consolidated net leverage ratio of the Issuers and its restricted subsidiaries is met. In addition, in connection with certain tender offers for the Senior Secured Notes or the Senior Notes, if holders of not less than 90% in aggregate principal amount of the applicable outstanding Notes validly tender and do not withdraw such Notes in such tender offer and the relevant Issuer, or any third party making such a tender offer in lieu of such Issuer, purchases, all of the Notes validly tendered and not withdrawn by such holders, the relevant Issuer or such third party will have the right to redeem the Notes that remain outstanding in whole, but not in part, following such purchase at a price equal to the price offered to each other holder of Notes. See “Description of the Senior Secured Notes—Optional Redemption” and “Description of the Senior Notes— _Optional Redemption.”_

Subsection Title: Risks Related to the Notes, the Guarantees and the Collateral
Subsubsection Title: The term “all or substantially all” in the context of a change of control has no clearly established meaning under relevant law and is subject to judicial interpretation such that it may not be certain that a change of control has occurred or will occur.
Subsubsection Text: Upon the occurrence of a transaction that constitutes a change of control under the Indentures, the relevant Issuer will be required to make an offer to repurchase all outstanding Notes tendered. The definition of “change of control” in the Indentures will include (with certain exceptions) a disposition of all or substantially all of the 92 ----- assets of the relevant Issuer and its restricted subsidiaries (taken as a whole), to any person. Although there is a limited body of case law interpreting the phrase “all or substantially all,” it has no clearly established meaning under relevant law, varies according to the facts and circumstances of the subject transaction and is subject to judicial interpretation. Accordingly, in certain circumstances, there may be a degree of uncertainty in ascertaining whether a particular transaction would involve a disposition of “all or substantially all” of the assets of a person, and therefore it may be unclear whether a change of control has occurred and whether the relevant Issuer is required to make an offer to repurchase the Notes.

Subsection Title: Risks Related to the Notes, the Guarantees and the Collateral
Subsubsection Title: Credit ratings may not reflect all risks, are not recommendations to buy or hold securities and may be subject to revision, suspension or withdrawal at any time.
Subsubsection Text: One or more independent credit rating agencies are expected to assign credit ratings to the Notes. The credit ratings address our ability to perform our obligations under the terms of the Notes and credit risks in determining the likelihood that payments will be made when due under the Notes. The ratings may not reflect the potential impact of all risks related to the structure, market, additional risk factors discussed above and other factors that may affect the value of the Notes. A credit rating is not a recommendation to buy, sell or hold securities and may be subject to revision, suspension or withdrawal by the rating agency at any time. No assurance can be given that a credit rating will remain constant for any given period of time or that a credit rating will not be lowered or withdrawn entirely by the credit rating agency if in its judgment circumstances in the future so warrant. A suspension, reduction or withdrawal at any time of the credit rating assigned to the Notes by one or more of the credit rating agencies may adversely affect the cost, terms and conditions of our financings and could adversely affect the value and trading of the Notes.

Subsection Title: Risks Related to the Notes, the Guarantees and the Collateral
Subsubsection Title: Certain covenants may be suspended upon the occurrence of a change in our ratings.
Subsubsection Text: Each of the Senior Secured Notes Indenture and the Senior Notes Indenture will provide that, if at any time following the date of the relevant Indenture, any series of the Notes receive a rating of “Baa3” or better from Moody’s Investors Service, Inc. (“Moody’s”) or “BBB-” or better from Standard & Poor’s Investors Ratings Services (“S&P”) and no default or event of default has occurred and is continuing, then beginning that day and continuing until such time that the Notes receive a rating below “Baa3” from Moody’s or “BBB-” from S&P, certain covenants will cease to be applicable to the Notes. See “Description of the Senior Secured Notes—Certain _Covenants—Suspension of Covenants on Achievement of Investment Grade Status” and “Description of the Senior Notes—Certain Covenants—Suspension of Covenants on Achievement of Investment Grade Status.” If_ these covenants were to cease to be applicable, we would be able to incur additional indebtedness or make payments, including dividends or investments, which may conflict with the interests of holders of the Notes. There can be no assurance that the Notes will ever achieve an investment grade rating or that any such rating will be maintained.

Subsection Title: Risks Related to the Notes, the Guarantees and the Collateral
Subsubsection Title: The Notes may not become or remain listed on the Exchange.
Subsubsection Text: Application will be made to The International Stock Exchange Authority Limited for the listing of and permission to deal in the Notes on the Official List of The International Stock Exchange (the “Exchange”). However, there can be no assurance that the Notes will become or remain listed. If the Issuers cannot maintain the listing on the Exchange and the admission to dealing on the Official List thereof, or if it becomes unduly burdensome to make or maintain such listing, the Issuers may cease to make or maintain such listing on the Official List of the Exchange. Listing of any of the Notes on the Exchange does not imply that a public offering of any of the Notes in the Channel Islands has been authorized. Although no assurance is made as to the liquidity of the Notes as a result of listing on the Official List of the Exchange or another recognized listing exchange for comparable issuers, failure to be approved for listing or the delisting of the Notes from the Official List of the Exchange or another listing exchange may have an adverse effect on a holder’s ability to resell Notes in the secondary market.

Subsection Title: Risks Related to the Notes, the Guarantees and the Collateral
Subsubsection Title: You may face foreign exchange risks by investing in the Notes, which risk may be increased if the euro no longer exists or if the Notes are otherwise redenominated as a result of Member States leaving the eurozone.
Subsubsection Text: The Dollar Senior Secured Notes will be denominated and payable in U.S. dollars. The Euro Senior Secured Notes and the Senior Notes will be denominated and payable in euro. If investors measure their investment returns by reference to a currency other than euro or U.S. dollars, as applicable, an investment in the Notes will entail foreign exchange-related risks due to, among other factors, possible significant changes in the value of the euro or U.S. dollar, as applicable, relative to the currency by reference to which investors measure the return on 93 ----- their investments because of economic, political and other factors over which we have no control. Depreciation of the euro or U.S. dollar, as applicable, against the currency by reference to which investors measure the return on their investments could cause a decrease in the effective yield of the Notes below their stated coupon rates and could result in a loss to investors when the return on the Notes is translated into the currency by reference to which the investors measure the return on their investments. Investments in the Notes by U.S. holders (as defined in “Certain Tax Considerations—Certain U.S. Federal Income Tax Considerations”) may also have important tax consequences as a result of foreign exchange gains or losses, if any. See “Certain Tax Considerations— _Certain U.S. Federal Income Tax Considerations.” Despite the measures taken by countries in the eurozone to_ alleviate credit risk, concerns persist regarding the debt burden of certain eurozone countries and their ability to meet future financial obligations, the overall stability of the euro and the suitability of the euro as a single currency given the diverse economic and political circumstances in individual eurozone Member States. These and other concerns could lead to the reintroduction of individual currencies in one or more Member States, or, in more extreme circumstances, the possible dissolution of the euro entirely. Should the euro dissolve entirely, the legal and contractual consequences for holders of euro-denominated obligations would be determined bylaws in effect at such time. We cannot assure you that the official exchange rate at which the Notes may be redenominated would accurately reflect their value in euro or U.S. dollars, as applicable. These potential developments, or market perceptions concerning these developments and related issues, could adversely affect the value of the Notes.

Subsection Title: Risks Related to the Notes, the Guarantees and the Collateral
Subsubsection Title: The grant of Collateral to secure the Notes might be challenged or voidable in an insolvency proceeding.
Subsubsection Text: The grant of Collateral in favor of the Security Agent may be voidable by the grantor or by an insolvency trustee, liquidator, receiver or administrator or by other creditors, or may be otherwise set aside by a court, or be unenforceable if certain events or circumstances exist or occur, including, among others, if the grantor is deemed to be insolvent at the time of the grant, or if the grant permits the secured parties to receive a greater recovery than if the grant had not been given and an insolvency proceeding in respect of the grantor is commenced within a legally specified “clawback” period following the grant. See “Certain Insolvency Law Considerations and _Limitations on the Validity and Enforceability of the Guarantees and the Security Interests.”_

Subsection Title: Risks Related to the Notes, the Guarantees and the Collateral
Subsubsection Title: The market value of the Notes could decrease if our creditworthiness worsens.
Subsubsection Text: The market value of the Notes will suffer if the market perceives us to be less likely to fully perform all obligations under the Notes when they fall due, which could occur, for example, because of the materialization of any of the risks listed herein regarding the Group. Even if the likelihood that we will be in position to fully perform all of our obligations under the Notes when they fall due has not actually decreased, market participants could have a different perception. In addition, the market participants’ estimation of the creditworthiness of corporate debtors in general or of debtors operating in the same business as us could change adversely, causing the market value of the Notes to fall. If any of these risks were to occur, third parties would only be willing to purchase Notes for a lower price than before the materialization of these risks. Under these circumstances, the market value of the Notes will decrease. 94 -----

_An investment in the Notes involves a high degree of risk. In addition to considering carefully, in light of the circumstances and your individual investment objectives, the information contained elsewhere in this offering memorandum, you should carefully consider the risks described below before investing in the Notes. If any of the events described below actually occurs, our business, results of operations, financial condition or prospects could be materially adversely affected and, accordingly, the value and the trading price of the Notes may decline, resulting in a loss of all or part of any investment in the Notes. The order in which the risk factors are presented does not necessarily reflect the likelihood of their occurrence or the magnitude or significance of the individual risk factors. Furthermore, the risks and uncertainties described herein may not be the only ones that we face. Additional risks and uncertainties not presently known to us or that we currently consider to be immaterial may also have a material adverse effect on our business, results of operations, financial condition or prospects. Unless otherwise indicated, references to “we,” “us” and “our” in this section are to the Combined Group._

On the Issue Date, we will use the proceeds of the issuance of the Euro Senior Secured Notes to (A) redeem all of Banijay’s outstanding Existing Notes, (B) repay all amounts outstanding under Banijay’s Existing Senior Credit Facilities, (C) refinance the consideration paid for the Bear Grylls Acquisition, (D) fund cash to the balance sheet of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer, which we intend to use as part of the financing of the Endemol Shine Acquisition and (E) pay the fees and expenses incurred in connection with the Refinancing ((A), (B), (C), (D) and (E) collectively, the “Refinancing”). If the Endemol Shine Acquisition is not consummated, the portion of the proceeds of the Euro Senior Secured Notes remaining on the balance sheet of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer will be used for the general corporate purposes of the Group, including the payment of certain fees and expenses in connection with the Endemol Shine Acquisition. See “Use of Proceeds.” In order to complete the Refinancing, the Senior Secured Notes Issuer will on-lend on or around the Issue Date a portion of the proceeds of the Euro Senior Secured Notes by way of the Senior Secured Notes Proceeds Loans to its subsidiaries that entered into intercompany loans with the Senior Notes Issuer in 2017 to receive a portion of the proceeds of the issuance of the Existing Notes and borrowings under the Existing Senior Credit Facilities. The Senior Secured Notes Issuer and these subsidiaries will use the proceeds of the Senior Secured Notes Proceeds Loans to repay these intercompany loans and other intercompany debt, such as vendor notes, to the Senior Notes Issuer, which will use these proceeds to repay the Existing Notes and the Existing Senior Credit Facilities. See “Summary— _Corporate and Financing Structure.”_

On October 25, 2019, we entered into the Endemol Shine Acquisition Agreement to acquire the entire share capital of the Target from the Sellers. Following the completion of the Endemol Shine Acquisition, the Senior Secured Notes Issuer will hold 100% of the shares of the Target. The consummation of the Endemol Shine Acquisition is subject to the satisfaction of certain conditions, including clearance by the antitrust authorities. Under the terms of the Endemol Shine Acquisition Agreement, the Senior Secured Notes Issuer has agreed to take all necessary steps to obtain the required clearances after the signing of the Endemol Shine Acquisition Agreement. If these conditions are not satisfied on or prior to January 25, 2021, and such date has not been extended by the parties, the Endemol Shine Acquisition Agreement may be terminated. The Endemol Shine Acquisition Agreement contains customary warranties and indemnities given by the Sellers and the Target as to capacity, title and disclosure as well as customary covenants given by the Sellers regarding, among other things, the conduct of the business and the affairs of Endemol Shine pending the completion of the Endemol Shine Acquisition. The Sellers’ liability for any breach of a warranty is subject to certain thresholds and limitations. The consummation of the Endemol Shine Acquisition (including the repayment of certain existing indebtedness owed by the Target and certain of its subsidiaries, as well as the payment of estimated transaction fees and expenses) is expected to require an aggregate of €2,018.0 million (equivalent) in a combination of debt financing and equity. The Endemol Shine Acquisition, the repayment of certain existing debt of Endemol Shine, and the related transaction fees and expenses will be financed through (i) (A) the issuance of the Dollar Senior Secured Notes and the Senior Notes in the aggregate principal amount of €725.0 million (equivalent) and (B) drawings under the EUR Term Loan B and the USD Term Loan B in the aggregate principal amount of €953.0 million (equivalent) ((A) and (B) collectively, the “Acquisition Financing”), (ii) €275.0 million of cash funding to be provided by Financière LOV S.A.S. and Fimalac, together through LDH, and by Vivendi to Banijay Group Holding, which will contribute such funds to the Senior Notes Issuer, which will in turn contribute such funds to the Senior Secured Notes Issuer, by way of an equity contribution (the “Equity Contribution”) and (iii) the portion of the proceeds of the issuance of the Euro Senior Secured Notes remaining on the balance sheet of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer. On the Acquisition Completion Date, the Senior Notes Issuer will advance the proceeds of the Senior Notes Offering to the Senior Secured Notes Issuer by way of the 95 ----- Senior Notes Proceeds Loan. The proceeds of the Acquisition Financing and the Equity Contribution will be used as further described under “—Sources and Uses of the Transactions.” There can be no guarantee that the Endemol Shine Acquisition will be consummated. If the Endemol Shine Acquisition is not consummated, the Senior Secured Notes Issuer will not be required under the Senior Secured Notes Indenture to redeem the Euro Senior Secured Notes and the proceeds from the Euro Senior Secured Notes will be applied towards the Refinancing, while the Dollar Senior Secured Notes and the Senior Notes will be subject to a Special Mandatory Redemption, as more fully described under “Description of the Senior Secured _Notes—Escrow of Proceeds; Special Mandatory Redemption” and “Description of the Senior Notes—Escrow of Proceeds; Special Mandatory Redemption.” If the Endemol Shine Acquisition is not consummated, the_ commitments under the EUR Term Loan B and the USD Term Loan B will be canceled, but the Euro Senior Secured Notes will remain outstanding, and drawings up to €75.0 million (equivalent) will remain available under the Revolving Credit Facility to fund the ongoing operations of Banijay. If the Endemol Shine Acquisition is not consummated, the Revolving Credit Facility will be automatically designated as a super senior liability in accordance with, and subject to, the terms of the Intercreditor Agreement.

Pending the consummation of the Endemol Shine Acquisition, the Initial Purchasers will deposit the gross proceeds from the offering of the Dollar Senior Secured Notes into the Dollar Senior Secured Notes Escrow Account and the gross proceeds from the offering of the Senior Notes into the Senior Notes Escrow Account. The Escrow Accounts will be controlled by the Escrow Agent and will be pledged on a first-priority basis in favor of the relevant Trustee on behalf of the holders of the respective series of the Notes. See “Summary—The _Offering—Collateral.” The release of the Escrowed Property from the Escrow Accounts is subject to the_ satisfaction of certain conditions, including the consummation of the Endemol Shine Acquisition within one Business Day following release of the Escrowed Property from the Escrow Accounts. If these conditions are not satisfied on or before the Escrow Longstop Date or upon the occurrence of certain other events, the Dollar Senior Secured Notes and the Senior Notes will be subject to a Special Mandatory Redemption. The Special Mandatory Redemption Price for the Dollar Senior Secured Notes and the Senior Notes will be equal to 100% of the aggregate issue price of the Dollar Senior Secured Notes and the Senior Notes, as applicable, plus accrued and unpaid interest and additional amounts, if any, to, but excluding, the date of such Special Mandatory Redemption. See “Description of the Senior Secured Notes—Escrow of Proceeds; Special Mandatory _Redemption,” “Description of the Senior Notes—Escrow of Proceeds; Special Mandatory Redemption” and “Risk Factors—The Endemol Shine Acquisition is subject to certain conditions, uncertainties and risks and, if it is not consummated, the Issuers may redeem their respective Dollar Senior Secured Notes and Senior Notes at 100% of the issue price, plus accrued and unpaid interest.”_ On the Issue Date, the gross proceeds of the Euro Senior Secured Notes will not be placed into an escrow account and are intended to be used as set forth in “Use of Proceeds.” The Euro Senior Secured Notes are not subject to a special mandatory redemption and, as a result, will remain outstanding even if the Endemol Shine Acquisition is not consummated and the Dollar Senior Secured Notes and the Senior Notes are redeemed pursuant to a special mandatory redemption applicable to those Notes. See “Risk Factors—Risks Related to the _Endemol Shine Acquisition—The Euro Senior Secured Notes are not subject to a special mandatory redemption and will remain outstanding even if the Endemol Shine Acquisition is not consummated, in which case the amount available under the Revolving Credit Facility would be limited and such facility will be automatically designated as a super senior liability in accordance with, and subject to, the terms of the Intercreditor Agreement.”_ 96 -----

We refer to the Offering, the Refinancing, the Acquisition Financing, the Endemol Shine Acquisition and the repayment of certain existing debt of Endemol Shine, each as described below, collectively as the “Transactions.” On the Issue Date, we expect to consummate the Offering, the Refinancing and the Acquisition Financing. On the Acquisition Completion Date, we expect to consummate the Endemol Shine Acquisition and the repayment of certain existing debt of Endemol Shine. See “Use of Proceeds,” “Capitalization,” “Description of Other Indebtedness and Financing Arrangements,” “Description of the Senior Secured Notes” and “Description of the Senior Notes.”

Subsubsection Title: Sources and Uses for the Endemol Shine Acquisition
Subsubsection Text: The expected estimated sources and uses of the funds necessary to consummate the Endemol Shine Acquisition and repay certain existing debt of Endemol Shine are shown in the table below, based on an assumed closing date of March 31, 2020. Actual amounts may differ from estimated amounts depending on several factors, including the issue price of the Dollar Senior Secured Notes and the Senior Notes, differences between our estimates of fees and expenses and the actual fees and expenses incurred, fluctuations in exchange rates, 97 ----- accrued interest on the debt being repaid, the actual date of repayment of such debt and the actual date of the consummation of the Endemol Shine Acquisition.

(1) Represents the estimated gross proceeds of the Euro Senior Secured Notes offered hereby, assuming an issuance at par. (2) Represents the principal amount outstanding under the Existing Senior Term Loan immediately prior to the Refinancing (€44.6 million), plus accrued but unpaid interest up to, but excluding, the Issue Date (€0.2 million). (3) Represents (i) the principal amount outstanding under the Existing Notes (€365.0 million), plus (ii) the redemption premium (€7.3 million) to be paid to the holders of the Existing Notes on the Issue Date in connection with the Refinancing, plus (iii) accrued and unpaid interest on the Existing Notes up to, but excluding, the Issue Date (€1.2 million). (4) Represents the refinancing of the consideration paid for the Bear Grylls Acquisition. We drew £20.0 million under our Existing Revolving Credit Facility in October 2019 to pay the consideration for the Bear Grylls Acquisition, and repaid such drawing with cash generated by our business prior to December 31, 2019. A portion of the proceeds from the offering of the Euro Senior Secured Notes will be used to replenish our cash on hand for the same amount. (5) Represents the portion of the proceeds from the issuance of the Euro Senior Secured Notes that will remain on the balance sheet of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer on the Issue Date and that we intend to use as part of the financing of the Endemol Shine Acquisition on the Acquisition Completion Date. The Euro Senior Secured Notes are not subject to a special mandatory redemption and, as a result, will remain outstanding even if the Endemol Shine Acquisition is not consummated and the Dollar Senior Secured Notes and the Senior Notes are redeemed pursuant to a special mandatory redemption applicable to those Notes. See “Risk Factors—Risks Related to the _Endemol Shine Acquisition—The Euro Senior Secured Notes are not subject to a special mandatory redemption and will remain outstanding even if the Endemol Shine Acquisition is not consummated, in which case the amount available under the Revolving Credit Facility would be limited and such facility will be automatically designated as a super senior liability in accordance with, and subject to, the terms of the Intercreditor Agreement.” If the Endemol Shine Acquisition is not consummated, the portion of the proceeds of the Euro_ Senior Secured Notes remaining on the balance sheet of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer will be used for the general corporate purposes of the Group, including the payment of certain fees and expenses in connection with the Endemol Shine Acquisition. (6) Represents the estimated fees and expenses associated with the Refinancing, including placement, financial advisory and other transaction costs and professional fees.

(1) Represents the euro-equivalent of the estimated gross proceeds of the Dollar Senior Secured Notes offered hereby, assuming an issuance at par, which will be deposited into the Dollar Senior Secured Notes Escrow Account on the Issue Date. (2) Represents the estimated gross proceeds of the Senior Notes offered hereby, assuming an issuance at par, which will be deposited into the Senior Notes Escrow Account on the Issue Date. (3) Represents the euro-equivalent of amounts expected to be drawn under the EUR Term Loan B and the USD Term Loan B in connection with the Endemol Shine Acquisition on or about the Acquisition Completion Date, assuming borrowings at par. (4) Represents the combined shareholder funding to be provided by Financière LOV S.A.S. and Fimalac, together through LDH, and by Vivendi in connection with the Transactions. (5) Represents the purchase price for the entire share capital of the Target. (6) Represents the repayment of certain existing indebtedness of Endemol Shine, including indebtedness under its syndicated credit facilities (€1,553.0 million), indebtedness under a shareholder loan (€29.7 million), interest accrued on the foregoing (€39.3 million), the unwinding of certain hedging obligations in connection therewith (€6.0 million), the repayment of certain bilateral facilities (€5.8 million), as well as payment obligations under Endemol Shine’s long-term incentive plan (€15.4 million). We intend to roll over Endemol Shine’s Borrowing Base Facility (€44.6 million (equivalent)), its finance leases (€136.9 million) and a portion of its bilateral facilities (€27.2 million). See “Capitalization.” (7) Represents the estimated fees and expenses associated with the Transactions, including placement, financial advisory and other transaction costs and professional fees. 98 -----

The gross proceeds from the sale of the Notes will be approximately €1,250.0 million (equivalent). On the Issue Date, we intend to use the proceeds of the offering of the Euro Senior Secured Notes to (i) redeem all of Banijay’s outstanding Existing Notes, (ii) repay all amounts outstanding under Banijay’s Existing Senior Credit Facilities, (iii) refinance the consideration paid for the Bear Grylls Acquisition, (iv) fund cash to the balance sheet of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer, which we intend to use as part of the financing of the Endemol Shine Acquisition and (v) pay the fees and expenses incurred in connection with the Refinancing. On the Acquisition Completion Date, we intend to use the proceeds of the offering of the Dollar Senior Secured Notes and the Senior Notes, together with the Equity Contribution, and amounts drawn under the Senior Facilities and the portion of the cash proceeds of the offering of the Euro Senior Secured Notes remaining on our balance sheet, to (i) acquire 100% of the share capital of the Target, (ii) refinance certain existing indebtedness of the Target and (iii) pay the fees and expenses incurred in connection with the Transactions.

The as further adjusted for the Endemol Shine Acquisition amount gives effect to the cash position of Endemol Shine, net of overdraft as of September 30, 2019 (€43.6 million), and net of €31.3 million of cash that we will use following the completion of the Endemol Shine Acquisition to pay certain fees due to the Sellers under their existing agreements with Endemol Shine. The as adjusted for the Refinancing and as further adjusted for the Endemol Shine Acquisition amounts do not include any adjustments to our cash and cash equivalents due to working capital expansion or contraction or any other cash utilization since September 30, 2019. (2) Represents outstanding indebtedness under our Existing Senior Term Loan which will be repaid as part of the Refinancing, excluding accrued but unpaid interest. (3) Represents outstanding indebtedness under our Existing Notes which will be repaid as part of the Refinancing, excluding accrued but unpaid interest. (4) Represents the aggregate principal amount of the Euro Senior Secured Notes offered hereby. If the Endemol Shine Acquisition is not consummated, the Euro Senior Secured Notes will remain outstanding. See “Risk Factors—Risks Related to the Endemol Shine _Acquisition—The Euro Senior Secured Notes are not subject to a special mandatory redemption and will remain outstanding even if the Endemol Shine Acquisition is not consummated, in which case the amount available under the Revolving Credit Facility would be limited and such facility will be automatically designated as a super senior liability in accordance with, and subject to, the terms of the Intercreditor Agreement.”_ (5) Represents the euro-equivalent of the aggregate principal amount of the Dollar Senior Secured Notes offered hereby. If the Endemol Shine Acquisition is not consummated, the Dollar Senior Secured Notes will be subject to a Special Mandatory Redemption. See “The _Transactions.”_ (6) In connection with the Transactions, the Senior Secured Notes Issuer will enter into the Senior Secured Credit Facilities Agreement to provide for a EUR Term Loan B and a USD Term Loan B in an aggregate principal amount of €953.0 million (equivalent) and a Revolving Credit Facility in the amount of €170.0 million to finance the general corporate and ongoing working capital needs of the Group, of which €75.0 million (equivalent) will be available prior to the Acquisition Completion Date. We currently expect the 99 ----- Revolving Credit Facility to remain undrawn on the Issue Date. See “Description of Other Indebtedness and Financing Arrangements— _Senior Secured Credit Facilities Agreement.” If the Endemol Shine Acquisition is not consummated, the EUR Term Loan B and the_ USD Term Loan B will not be drawn and commitments under the EUR Term Loan B and the USD Term Loan B will be canceled. However, drawings up to €75.0 million (equivalent) will remain available under the Revolving Credit Facility to fund the ongoing operations of Banijay. If the Endemol Shine Acquisition is not consummated, the Revolving Credit Facility will be automatically designated as a super senior liability in accordance with the terms of the Intercreditor Agreement. See “The Transactions.” (7) Amounts are not reduced by the amount of capitalized debt issuance costs. (8) The actual amount represents existing third-party borrowings of Banijay, which consist of various credit facilities (including recourse factoring or assignment of receivables or future receivables) to finance the development, production and operation of Banijay’s programs and audiovisual or digital content. As of September 30, 2019, Banijay had €56.4 million outstanding under these credit facilities. See “Description of Other Indebtedness and Financing Arrangements—Other Financing Arrangements of Banijay.” (9) The as further adjusted for the Endemol Shine Acquisition amount gives effect to third-party borrowings of Endemol Shine that are expected to remain outstanding following the completion of the Transactions. Those include €44.6 million (equivalent) under the Borrowing Base Facility and €27.2 million under various credit facilities (including recourse factoring or assignment of receivables or future receivables) to finance the development, production and operation of programs and audiovisual or digital content of Endemol Shine. See “Description of Other Indebtedness and Financing Arrangements—Other Financing Arrangements of Endemol Shine.” (10) Lease liabilities represents amounts payable under leases that are accounted for in accordance with IFRS 16. Following the first application of IFRS 16, we now recognize lease liabilities on our consolidated balance sheet which had previously been classified as “operating leases” under the principles of IAS 17. (11) The as adjusted amount gives effect to the estimated impact of the Endemol Shine Acquisition on our lease liabilities. See “Banijay’s _Management’s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations—Factors Affecting Comparability of Our Financial Statements—Changes to Accounting Standards—IFRS 16.”_ (12) Represents the aggregate principal amount of the Senior Notes offered hereby. If the Endemol Shine Acquisition is not consummated, the Senior Notes will be subject to a Special Mandatory Redemption. See “The Transactions.” (13) The as adjusted amount gives effect to the shareholder funding provided under the Equity Contribution. See “Use of Proceeds.” 100 -----

Subsection Title: Notes to the Unaudited Pro Forma Consolidated Financial Information
Subsubsection Text: We refer to the Offering, the Endemol Shine Acquisition, the repayment of certain existing debt of Endemol Shine, the Acquisition Financing and the Refinancing collectively as the “Transactions.” _The Refinancing_ On the Issue Date, Banijay will use the proceeds of the issuance of the Euro Senior Secured Notes to (A) redeem all of its outstanding Existing Notes, (B) repay all amounts outstanding under its Existing Senior Credit Facilities, (C) refinance the consideration paid for the Bear Grylls Acquisition, (D) fund cash to the balance sheet of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer, which Banijay intends to use as part of the financing of the Endemol Shine Acquisition and (E) pay the fees and expenses incurred in connection with the Refinancing ((A), (B), (C), (D) and (E) collectively, the “Refinancing”). If the Endemol Shine Acquisition is not consummated, the portion of the proceeds of the Euro Senior Secured Notes remaining on the balance sheet of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer will be used for the general corporate purposes of the Group, including the payment of certain fees and expenses in connection with the Endemol Shine Acquisition. See “Use of Proceeds.” In order to complete the Refinancing, the Senior Secured Notes Issuer will on-lend on or around the Issue Date a portion of the proceeds of the Euro Senior Secured Notes by way of the Senior Secured Notes Proceeds Loans to its subsidiaries that entered into intercompany loans with the Senior Notes Issuer in 2017 to receive a portion of the proceeds of the issuance of the Existing Notes and borrowings under the Existing Senior Credit Facilities. The Senior Secured Notes Issuer and these subsidiaries will use the proceeds of the Senior Secured Notes Proceeds Loans to repay these intercompany loans and other intercompany debt, such as vendor notes, to the Senior Notes Issuer, which will use these proceeds to repay the Existing Notes and the Existing Senior Credit Facilities. The Bear Grylls Acquisition was closed on October 7, 2019 and was not considered sufficiently significant to be reflected in the Unaudited Pro Forma Financial Information. _The Endemol Shine Acquisition_ On October 25, 2019, Banijay entered into the Endemol Shine Acquisition Agreement to acquire the entire share capital of the Target from the Sellers. Following the completion of the Endemol Shine Acquisition, the Senior Secured Notes Issuer will hold 100% of the shares of the Target. The consummation of the Endemol Shine Acquisition is subject to the satisfaction of certain conditions, including clearance by the antitrust authorities. Under the terms of the Endemol Shine Acquisition Agreement, the Senior Secured Notes Issuer has agreed to take all necessary steps to obtain the required clearances after the signing of the Endemol Shine Acquisition Agreement. If these conditions are not satisfied on or prior to January 25, 2021, and such date has not been extended by the parties, the Endemol Shine Acquisition Agreement may be terminated. The Endemol Shine Acquisition Agreement contains customary warranties and indemnities given by the Sellers and the Target as to capacity, title and disclosure as well as customary covenants given by the Sellers regarding, among other things, the conduct of the business and the affairs of Endemol Shine pending the completion of the Endemol Shine Acquisition. The Sellers’ liability for any breach of a warranty is subject to certain thresholds and limitations. The consummation of the Endemol Shine Acquisition (including the repayment of certain existing indebtedness owed by the Target and certain of its subsidiaries, as well as the payment of estimated transaction fees and expenses) is expected to require an aggregate of €2,018.0 million (equivalent) in a combination of debt financing and equity. The Endemol Shine Acquisition, the repayment of certain existing debt of Endemol Shine, and the related transaction fees and expenses will be financed through (i) (A) the issuance of the Dollar Senior Secured Notes and the Senior Notes in the aggregate principal amount of €725.0 million (equivalent) and (B) drawings under the EUR Term Loan B and the USD Term Loan B in the aggregate principal amount of €953.0 million (equivalent) ((A) and (B) collectively, the “Acquisition Financing”), (ii) €275.0 million of cash funding to be provided by Financière LOV S.A.S. and Fimalac, together through LDH, and by Vivendi to Banijay Group Holding, which will contribute such funds to the Senior Notes Issuer, which will in turn contribute such funds to the Senior Secured Notes Issuer, by way of an equity contribution (the “Equity Contribution”) and (iii) the portion of the proceeds of the issuance of the Euro Senior Secured Notes remaining on the balance sheet of the Senior Secured Notes Issuer. On the Acquisition Completion Date, the Senior Notes Issuer will advance the proceeds of the Senior Notes Offering to the Senior Secured Notes Issuer by way of the Senior Notes Proceeds Loan. The proceeds of the Acquisition Financing and the Equity Contribution will be used as further described under “—Sources and Uses of the Transactions.” 107 -----

Subsubsection Text: Below is an explanation of certain reclassifications applied to Endemol Shine’s historical accounts line items to conform to the expected financial statements pro forma line items of the combined Group: _Mapping Adjustments_ (a) Reclassification of €70.9 million from “Other intangible assets” to “Long-term content assets” in line with Banijay’s presentation of formats rights and TV rights. (b) Reclassification of €3.9 million from “Other financial assets” to “Non-current financial assets” in line with Banijay’s presentation of financial fixed assets. (c) Reclassification of €17.6 million from “Other financial assets” to “Loans and borrowings” in line with Banijay’s presentation of the mark-to-market of certain interest rate swaps. (d) Reclassification of €15.4 million from “Trade and other receivables” to “Other current assets” in line with Banijay’s presentation of certain accruals and other receivables. (e) Reclassification of €109.6 million from “Distribution advances” to “Other current assets” in line with Banijay’s presentation of distribution advances. (f) Reclassification of obligations under Endemol Shine’s incentive scheme from “Employee defined benefit obligations” to “Other long-term liabilities” (€16.4 million) and “Other current liabilities” (€9.4 million), respectively. (g) Reclassification of earn-out liabilities (€1.0 million) and put options liabilities (€2.1 million) in line with Banijay’s presentation under “Other long-term liabilities.” (h) Reclassification of “Translation reserves,” “Reserve for participating interests” and “Accumulated deficit” in line with Banijay’s presentation under “Retained earnings and other reserves.” 109 ----- (i) Reclassification of €35.2 million from “Put option liabilities” to “Other current liabilities” in line with Banijay’s presentation. (j) Reclassification of €75.3 million from “Trade and other payables” to “Other current liabilities” (€36.3 million) and to “Short-term borrowings and bank overdraft” (€39.0 million). The amounts reclassified to “Other current liabilities” relate to incentive plans (€21.3 million), provisions (€1.2 million) and other liabilities (€13.9 million). The amount reclassified to “Short-term borrowings and bank overdrafts” relates to accrued interest. _Presentation Adjustments_ On Banijay’s balance sheet, deferred income, work-in-progress, unbilled receivables and unbilled payables are classified in the captions “Other current liabilities,” “work-in-progress,” and “trade payables.” On Endemol Shine’s statement of financial position, these captions are grouped under amounts due to customers and due from customers to present the working capital exposure by project. The aim of the reclassification is to gross-up these two line items to follow Banijay’s presentation. (k) Reclassification of €243.0 million from “Other assets related to customers” and €117.4 million from “Other liabilities related to contracts with customers” to €359.2 million in “Work-in-progress,” €158.6 million in “Trade receivables” (related to unbilled revenue) and €392.2 in “Other current liabilities” (related to deferred revenue) to align the presentation of Banijay and Endemol Shine’s financial statements with those of Banijay. 110 ----- _2.1.2 Income Statement_ The following table presents the reclassification adjustments on the income statement of Endemol Shine for the year ended December 31, 2018:

Subsubsection Text: The Endemol Shine Acquisition will be accounted for using the acquisition method of accounting, which requires to determine and record the fair values of acquired assets and assumed liabilities as of the closing date of the acquisition. As of the date of the offering memorandum, we have not performed this valuation and the related allocation of the purchase price. Accordingly, no pro forma adjustment has been made to reflect the estimated fair value of identified intangible assets acquired and the purchase price allocation may result in significant adjustments to the historical values of property, plant and equipment and intangible assets, resulting in significant increases in depreciation and amortization expense. 113 ----- _3.1 Accounting policies alignments and Intercompany Eliminations 3.1.1 GAAP adjustments and accounting policies alignments:_ We have made the following adjustments to Endemol Shine’s historical income statement and statement of financial position to align the accounting policies of Endemol Shine with accounting policies of Banijay: (a) We have reclassified certain transactions for which Banijay and Endemol Shine have a different assessment of the agent versus principal relationship under IFRS 15 (Revenue from contracts with _customers). The impact of this reclassification between revenue and operating expenses for the year_ ended December 31, 2018, the nine months ended September 30, 2018 and the nine months ended September 30, 2019 amounted to €3.1 million, €3.3 million and €1.5 million, respectively. (b) We have aligned the discount rates used by Endemol Shine to determine liabilities in connection with put options held by non-controlling interests following an acquisition with the discount rate used by Banijay in the same periods. In the Unaudited Pro Forma Consolidated Income Statements, this adjustment amounted to €5.9 million for the year ended December 31, 2018, €4.4 million for the nine months ended September 30, 2018 and €3.6 million for the nine months ended September 30, 2019. In the Unaudited Pro Forma Consolidated Balance Sheet as of September 30, 2019, this adjustment resulted in a €0.9 million increase in other long-term liabilities, €0.4 million decrease in other current liabilities and €0.5 million decrease in retained earnings and other reserves. 3.1.2 Intercompany Elimination: (c) Intercompany transactions between Banijay Rights, a subsidiary of the Issuers, and Endemol Shine France have been identified in the amount of €0.3 million for the year ended December 31, 2018, €0.1 million for the nine months ended September 30, 2018 and €1.4 million for the nine months ended September 30, 2019. These intercompany transactions reflect royalties and format fees paid by Endemol Shine France to Banijay Rights. We have not identified any intercompany balances as of September 30, 2019 between Banijay Group and Endemol Shine group, consequently, no elimination of such balances was performed in the Unaudited _Pro Forma Consolidated Balance Sheet as of September 30, 2019. 3.2 Preliminary Purchase Accounting Adjustments_ The Acquisition has been accounted for as a business combination in the pro forma consolidated financial information, in accordance with IFRS 3 (Business Combinations) which requires that identifiable assets acquired and liabilities assumed be measured at their fair values as of the acquisition date. As of the date of the offering memorandum, we have not estimated the fair values of the identifiable assets acquired and liabilities assumed for purposes of the preliminary purchase accounting of Endemol Shine. The purchase accounting may result in significant adjustments to the historical values of property, plant and equipment and intangible assets, resulting in significant increase in depreciation and amortization expense. The purchase accounting is preliminary. In accordance with IFRS 3, the measurement period shall not exceed one year from the acquisition date. The following table presents our preliminary purchase accounting and reconciles the consideration payable in connection with the Endemol Shine Acquisition to goodwill recorded on our Unaudited Pro Forma Consolidated Balance Sheet as of September 30, 2019:

Subsubsection Text: The reclassifications above aim at presenting the income statements of Endemol Shine, which are presented by function, in line with the income statements of Banijay, which are presented by nature. This adjustment relates to the reclassification of expenses of €(1,738.1) million, €(1,119.1) million, €(1,101.8) million, for the year ended December 31, 2018, the nine months ended September 30, 2018 and the nine months ended September 30, 2019, respectively, from “Cost of sales” and ”Indirect cost of sales and overheads” to “Operating expenses,” “External expenses,” “Staff costs,” ”Depreciation and amortization” as well as “Other non-current operating income (expenses).”

Subsubsection Text: (1) Represents the consideration payable for the Endemol Shine Acquisition. See “Use of Proceeds.” (2) Represents equity of Endemol Shine as of September 30, 2019. As of the date of the offering memorandum, we have not estimated the fair values of the identifiable assets acquired and liabilities assumed for purposes of the preliminary purchase accounting of Endemol Shine. The purchase accounting may result in significant adjustments to the historical values of property, plant and equipment and intangible assets, resulting in significant increase in depreciation and amortization expense. 114 ----- (3) Represents goodwill recorded in Endemol Shine’s historical balance sheet as of September 30, 2019. (4) Represents the outstanding debt issuance costs as of September 30, 2019 relating to Endemol Shine’s debt accelerated as a consequence of its change of control/acquisition by Banijay (5) The goodwill transaction adjustment in our Unaudited Pro Forma Consolidated Balance Sheet as of September 30, 2019 is presented net of €1,143.7 million of historical goodwill, which is already recorded in the historical balance sheet of Endemol Shine as of September 30, 2019. The following pro forma adjustments have been made to the Unaudited Pro Forma Consolidated Financial Information to reflect the preliminary purchase accounting: (a) In the Unaudited Pro Forma Consolidated Balance Sheet as of September 30, 2019, we made an adjustment of €594.9 million in the “Goodwill” to reflect the difference between the preliminary goodwill amounting to €1,738.5 million and the historical goodwill of Endemol Shine amounting to €1,143.7 million. (b) In the Unaudited Pro Forma Consolidated Balance Sheet as of September 30, 2019, we made an adjustment of €(89.2) million on the cash and cash equivalents. This adjustment results from the difference between: (i) cash increase of €275.0 million corresponding to the equity contribution to be provided by Financière LOV S.A.S. and Fimalac, together through LDH, and by Vivendi to Banijay Group Holding, (ii) cash decrease of €313.6 corresponding to the consideration payable for the Endemol Shine Acquisition to the purchase price for the entire share capital of the Target, (iii) cash decrease of €31.3 million against “trade and other payables” corresponding to the payment of certain fees and expenses due to the Sellers under their existing agreements with Endemol Shine. (iv) cash decrease of €19.3 corresponding to the payment of the estimated acquisition costs (excluding debt issuance costs associated with the Refinancing and the Acquisition Financing which Banijay will capitalize and amortize over the duration period of the debt) including both (a) incurred costs as of September 30, 2019 for €4.9 million and (b) costs not yet incurred as of September 3, 2019 for €14.4 million (see note (e) below). (c) In the Unaudited Pro Forma Consolidated Balance Sheet as of September 30, 2019, we made adjustments to eliminate the net assets of Endemol Shine, that represent the equity of Endemol Shine as of September 30, 2019, including €14.9 million of issued capital, €824.3 million of share premiums and €(1,070.2) million of retained earnings and other reserves. (d) The Endemol Shine capitalized debt issuance costs as of September 30, 2019 amounting to €(50.1) million have been reversed from “Long-term borrowings and other financial liabilities” against “Goodwill” with regard to the purchase price accounting, due to the Endemol Shine’s debt acceleration as a consequence of its change of control/acquisition by Banijay. (e) The estimated costs of the Endemol Shine Acquisition (excluding costs associated with the Refinancing and the Acquisition Financing) not yet incurred as of September 30, 2019 by Banijay (€14.4 million) have been deducted from equity against “Cash and cash equivalents” in the Unaudited Pro Forma Consolidated Balance Sheet. Costs of the Endemol Shine Acquisition incurred by Banijay for the year ended December 31, 2018, in the nine months ended September 30, 2018 and in the nine months ended September 30, 2019 for €4.0 million, €3.3 million and €1.0 million, respectively, have been excluded from the Unaudited Pro Forma Consolidated Income Statements. An amount of €4.9 million was deducted from the cash position in the Unaudited Pro Forma Consolidated Balance Sheet of Banijay to give effect to the cash payment of such costs pursuant to September 30, 2019. No information as to transaction costs incurred by Endemol Shine after September 30, 2019 is available. Therefore, the value of the net assets of Endemol Shine has not been reduced, and the amount of preliminary goodwill has not been increased with respect to such acquisition costs if any. (f) Endemol Shine recorded impairments of its own goodwill for €44.1 million, €0.0 million and €0.0 million, respectively, for the year ended December 31, 2018, the nine months ended September 30, 2018 and the nine months ended September 30, 2019. Because we exclude the goodwill recorded in the Target’s historical financial statements (€1,143.7 million as of September 30, 2019) from the value of the net assets of Endemol Shine for purposes of the preliminary purchase accounting of Endemol Shine reflected in the Unaudited Pro Forma Consolidated Financial Information, the related impairments recorded in the historical consolidated income statements of Endemol Shine have been reversed. _3.3 Financing Adjustments_ We intend to roll over Endemol Shine’s Borrowing Base Facility (€44.6 million), its finance leases (€136.9 million) and a portion of its bilateral facilities (€27.2 million). 115 ----- The total gross proceeds from the new debt financing amount to €2,203.0 million, consisting of €325.0 million (equivalent) in aggregate principal amount of the Dollar Senior Secured Notes, €525.0 million in aggregate principal amount of Euro Senior Secured Notes, €400.0 million in aggregate principal amount of Senior Notes and €953.0 million aggregate drawings under the EUR Term Loan B and the USD Term Loan B, together. The proceeds of the offering of the Euro Senior Secured Notes will be used on the Issue Date as set forth in “The Transactions—The Refinancing” and the proceeds of the offering of the Dollar Senior Secured Notes and the Senior Notes, together with drawings under the EUR Term Loan B and the USD Term Loan B, the Equity Contribution and retained cash proceeds from the offering of the Euro Senior Secured Notes, will be used on the Acquisition Completion Date as set forth in “The Transactions—The Endemol Shine Acquisition.” Consequently, pro forma adjustments relating to these financings have been made, as detailed below, for the year ended December 31, 2018 and the nine months ended September 30, 2018 and September 30, 2019: - €2,147.3 million in connection to the issuing of the new debt amounting to €2,203.0 million and the amortization of the Transaction costs for €(55.7) million, - €424.7 million in connection with the repayment of existing debt of Banijay, consisting of the early redemption premium (€7.3 million) and refinancing of Banijay’s historical debt of €417.4 million as of September 30, 2019 (€405.9 million recorded under long-term borrowings and other financial liabilities and €11.5 million recorded under short-term borrowings and bank overdrafts) after reversing through the income statement the unamortized portion of the related debt issuance costs (€7.1 million); - €1,598.0 million in connection with the repayment of existing debt of Endemol Shine, consisting of €1,473.2 million recorded under long-term borrowings and other financial liabilities and €124.7 million recorded under short-term borrowings and bank overdrafts. These adjustments conducted to the following impacts: (a) €124.6 million increase in the “cash and cash equivalents” in the Unaudited Pro Forma Consolidated Balance Sheet as of September 30, 2019 as a result of (i) €2,147.3 million of the issuing of the new debt, (ii) €424.7 million of the repayment of existing debt of Banijay and (iii) €1,598.0 million of the repayment of existing debt of Endemol Shine. (b) Reduction of the equity of Banijay to give effect to (i) the redemption costs of the existing Notes of €(7.3) million and (ii) the amortization in full of €7.1 million of capitalized debt issuance costs related to indebtedness refinanced pursuant to the refinancing. (c) €320.9 million increase in the “long-term borrowings and other financial liabilities” and €131.7 million decrease in the “short-term borrowings and bank overdraft” in the Unaudited Pro Forma Consolidated Balance Sheet as of September 30, 2019 as a consequence of (i) €2,147.3 million corresponding to issuance of new debt amounting to €2,203.0 million and the amortization of the Transaction costs for €(55.7) million, (ii) refinancing of Banijay’s historical debt of €(410.3) million in connection with the repayment of existing debt of Banijay, and (iii) €(1,598.0) million in connection with the repayment of existing debt of Endemol Shine. The following pro forma adjustments were reflected in the Unaudited Pro Forma Consolidated Income Statements: (d) Interest expenses were recorded for Endemol Shine in the amount of €(133.4) million, €(100.8) million and €(110.3) million for the year ended December 31, 2018 and the nine months ended September 30, 2018 and September 30, 2019, respectively. Such interest expense consists of (i) interest expenses related to indebtedness of Endemol Shine that will be repaid and cancelled in connection with the Transactions for €(130.7) million, €(95.4) million and €(108.9)million; (ii) amortization fees related to the former refinancing of Endemol Shine for €(19.1) million, €(14.1) million and €(15.7) million and (iii) the write-off of the mark to market value of Endemol Shine’s interest rate swaps for €16.5 million, €8.7 million and €14.4 million, in each case for the year ended December 31, 2018 and the nine months ended September 30, 2018 and September 30, 2019, respectively. Accordingly, a corresponding adjustment is reflected for each period to reverse the historical interest expense of Endemol Shine for these periods. (e) Other finance income (costs) were recorded in the amount of €(48.6) million, €(33.0) million and €(38.2) million for the year ended December 31, 2018 and the nine months ended September 30, 2018 and September 30, 2019, respectively. These other finance costs related to foreign exchange impacts on the indebtedness of Endemol Shine. Accordingly, a corresponding adjustment is reflected for each period to reverse the historical finance costs of Endemol Shine for these periods. 116 ----- (f) Interest expenses were recorded in the amount of €(1.3) million, €3.7 million and €(14.6) million for the year ended December 31, 2018 and the nine months ended September 30, 2018 and September 30, 2019, respectively. These interests are made of (i) interests expenses related to indebtedness of Banijay that will be repaid and cancelled in connection with the Transactions for €(17.5) million, €(13.2) million and €(12.8) million; (ii) amortization fees related to the former refinancing for €(2.4) million, €(1.8) million and €(1.9) million and (iii) the write-off of the financing Transaction costs for €18.7 million, €18.7 million and €0.0 million for the year ended December 31, 2018 and the nine months ended September 30, 2018 and September 30, 2019, respectively. Accordingly, a corresponding adjustment is reflected for each period to reverse the historical interest expense of Banijay Group for these periods. Income taxes were computed on this adjustment using the corporate tax rate of 28% for €(0.4) million, €1.0 million and €(4.1) million for the year ended December 31, 2018 and the nine months ended September 30, 2018 and September 30, 2019, respectively. These interest expenses will be replaced by interest expenses associated with the EUR Term Loan B, the USD Term Loan B, the Revolving Credit Facility, the Euro Senior Secured Notes, the Dollar Senior Secured Notes and the Senior Notes in connection with the Transactions. For the year ended December 31, 2018, and for the nine months ended September 30, 2018 and the nine months ended September 30, 2019, interest expenses for new indebtedness incurred in connection with the Transactions were recorded in an aggregate of € million, € million and € million for the year ended December 31, 2018, and for the nine months ended September 30, 2018 and September 30, 2019, respectively. A 100 basis point increase or decrease in interest rates would result in a change in interest expense of €2.2 million, €1.7 million and €1.6 million for the year ended December 31, 2018, for the nine months ended September 30, 2018 and September 30, 2019, respectively. Subsubsection Text: No foreign exchange impacts have been reflected in connection with the USD Term Loan B or the Dollar Senior Secured Notes, as Banijay has estimated that it would be able to efficiently hedge this indebtedness for the year ended December 31, 2018 and the nine months ended September 30, 2018 and September 30, 2019. (g) The estimated costs related to the acquisition of Endemol Shine mainly include banking, legal and consulting fees and amount to €75.0 million, of which €58.3 million are related to the new indebtedness issuance and amortized over the duration period of the debt. As a result, interest expenses were recorded in the Unaudited Pro Forma Consolidated Income Statements for €10.7 million, €8.0 million and €8.0 million for the year ended December 31, 2018 and the nine months ended September 30, 2018 and September 30, 2019, respectively. No income taxes deductions have been computed in connection with the new indebtedness incurred in connection with the Transactions, as Banijay determined that there was not sufficient visibility on the potential future tax deductions of these interest expenses and the capacity to benefit from those tax deductions in future taxable income. 117 -----

Section Title: UNAUDITED PRO FORMA CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL INFORMATION
Subsubsection Text: The Unaudited Pro Forma Consolidated Financial Information is presented to illustrate the effects of the Transactions on the historical balance sheet and income statements of Banijay and Endemol Shine. The Transactions consist of the Endemol Shine Acquisition, the repayment of certain existing debt of Endemol Shine in connection with the Endemol Shine Acquisition, the Equity Contribution, the Acquisition Financing and the Refinancing, each as further described in Note 1 (Description of the Transactions) to the Unaudited Pro Forma Consolidated Financial Information. The Refinancing is an integral part of the Transactions, and will occur prior to the completion of the Endemol Shine Acquisition. See also “Summary—The Transactions” and “Use of _Proceeds.”_ The Unaudited Pro Forma Consolidated Financial Information has been prepared on a basis consistent with the accounting policies and presentation adopted by Banijay in its consolidated financial statements for the year ended December 31, 2018, and is comprised of: (i) the 2018 Full-Year Unaudited Pro Forma Consolidated Income Statement, (ii) the 2018 Interim Unaudited Pro Forma Consolidated Income Statement; (iii) the 2019 Interim Unaudited Pro Forma Consolidated Income Statement (together with the 2018 FullYear Unaudited Pro Forma Consolidated Income Statement and the 2018 Interim Unaudited Pro Forma Consolidated Income Statement, the “Unaudited Pro Forma Consolidated Income Statements”, each of which gives pro forma effect to the Transactions as if they had occurred on January 1, 2018; and (iv) the Unaudited Pro Forma Consolidated Balance Sheet, which gives pro forma effect to the Transactions as if they had occurred as of September 30, 2019 (together with the Unaudited Pro Forma Consolidated Income Statements, the “Unaudited Pro Forma Consolidated Financial Information”). The Unaudited Pro Forma Consolidated Financial Information is based upon available information, including preliminary estimates that are subject to change once more detailed information is obtained, and certain assumptions that we believe to be reasonable. For example, historical interest expenses in connection with indebtedness of Endemol Shine and Banijay that will be repaid and cancelled in connection with the Transactions will be replaced by interest expenses associated with the Senior Facilities and the Notes and, accordingly, an adjustment is reflected in the Unaudited Pro Forma Consolidated Income Statements to reverse the historical interest expense of Endemol Shine and Banijay for these periods. The pro forma adjustments in the Unaudited _Pro Forma Consolidated Financial Information in this preliminary offering memorandum do not include interest_ expenses on the Senior Facilities, Euro Senior Secured Notes, Dollar Senior Secured Notes and Senior Notes. We will update the Unaudited Pro Forma Consolidated Financial Information in the final offering memorandum to reflect the pro forma adjustments on interest expenses using the actual interest rates for the Senior Facilities, Euro Senior Secured Notes, Dollar Senior Secured Notes and Senior Notes when available. In addition, the Endemol Shine Acquisition will be accounted for using the acquisition method of accounting, which requires determination of the fair values of identifiable assets and liabilities as of the closing date to record identified acquired assets and assumed liabilities at fair value. As of the date of the offering memorandum, we have not estimated the fair values of the identifiable assets acquired and liabilities assumed for purposes of the preliminary purchase accounting of Endemol Shine. The purchase accounting may result in significant adjustments to the historical values of property, plant and equipment and intangible assets, resulting in significant increase in depreciation and amortization expense. See Note 3.1 (Preliminary Purchase Accounting Adjustments) to the Unaudited Pro Forma Consolidated Financial Information for a further discussion of the purchase accounting reflected in the Unaudited Pro Forma Consolidated Financial Information and its impact on earnings. In addition, transactions that occurred between Banijay and Endemol Shine were deemed as intercompany transactions and the revenues and expenses resulting from these intercompany transactions were eliminated in the Unaudited Pro _Forma Consolidated Financial Information. See Note 3.4 (Intercompany Eliminations). Moreover, the Unaudited Pro Forma Consolidated Financial Information does not reflect any cost savings, other synergies or revenue_ enhancements that the Combined Group may achieve as a result of the Endemol Shine Acquisition, the costs to integrate the operations of Banijay and Endemol Shine or the costs necessary to achieve such cost savings, synergies and revenue enhancements. Accordingly, the estimates and assumptions reflected in the Unaudited Pro _Forma Consolidated Financial Information may be materially different from the Combined Group’s actual or_ future results. In the tabular presentation of the Unaudited Pro Forma Consolidated Balance Sheet and of the Unaudited _Pro Forma Consolidated Income Statements:_ - the Consolidated Balance Sheet as of September 30, 2019 and the Consolidated Income Statements for the nine months ended September 30, 2019 and September 30, 2018 of Banijay have been extracted 101 ----- from the Unaudited Interim Banijay Financial Statements and the Consolidated Income Statement for the year ended December 31, 2018 of Banijay has been extracted from the Audited Banijay Financial Statements as of and for the year ended December 31, 2018; - the Consolidated Balance Sheet as of September 30, 2019 and the Consolidated Income Statements for the nine months ended September 30, 2019 and September 30, 2018 of Endemol Shine have been extracted from the Unaudited Interim Endemol Shine Financial Statements, and the Consolidated Income Statement for the year ended December 31, 2018 of Endemol Shine has been extracted from the Audited Endemol Shine Financial Statements as of and for the year ended December 31, 2018, and in each case have been reclassified as disclosed in Note 2.1 (Reclassifications) below, in order to align them with the mapping of the Unaudited Pro Forma Consolidated Financial Information for Banijay. The Unaudited Pro Forma Consolidated Financial Information has not been prepared in accordance with Regulation S-X of the Securities Act. The Unaudited Pro Forma Consolidated Financial Information is for illustrative purposes only and should not be considered indicative of actual results that would have been achieved had the Transactions been consummated on the dates indicated and do not purport to indicate our future consolidated results of operations or financial position. The Unaudited Pro Forma Consolidated Financial Information does not give effect to any events other than those discussed in the Unaudited Pro Forma Consolidated Financial Information and the notes thereto. As a result, you should not place undue reliance on the Unaudited Pro Forma Consolidated Financial Information presented herein. Unless otherwise noted, all amounts presented in the Unaudited Pro Forma Consolidated Financial Information are in millions of euros. The Unaudited Pro Forma Consolidated Financial Information has been rounded for ease of presentation and, accordingly, in certain cases, the sum of the numbers in a column may not conform to the total figure given for that column. The Unaudited Pro Forma Consolidated Balance Sheet and the 2019 Interim Unaudited Pro Forma Consolidated Income Statement have been prepared and are presented in accordance with IFRS 16. The 2018 Full-Year Unaudited Pro Forma Consolidated Income Statement and the 2018 Interim Unaudited Pro Forma Consolidated Income Statement have been prepared and are presented in accordance with IAS 17. Accordingly, the 2019 Interim Unaudited Pro Forma Consolidated Income Statement are not fully comparable with the 2018 Full-Year Unaudited Pro Forma Consolidated Income Statement and the 2018 Interim Unaudited Pro Forma Consolidated Income Statement. See “Banijay’s Management’s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition _and Results of Operations—Factors Affecting Comparability of Our Financial Statements—Changes to Accounting Standards—IFRS 16” and “Endemol Shine’s Management’s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations—Factors Affecting Comparability of Our Financial Statements—Changes to Accounting Standards—IFRS 16.”_ The Unaudited Pro Forma Consolidated Financial Information should be read in conjunction with the accompanying notes as well as the consolidated financial statements of the Senior Notes Issuer and Endemol Shine and, in each case, the notes thereto included elsewhere in this offering memorandum and “Disclosure _Regarding_ _Forward-Looking_ _Statements,”_ “Risk _Factors,”_ “The _Transactions,”_ “Use _of_ _Proceeds,”_ “Capitalization,” “Selected Historical Financial Information,” “Banijay’s Management’s Discussion and _Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations” and “Endemol Shine’s Management’s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations.”_ 102 -----
